analyzed: tatas śiva ambhasā śiṣyam prokṣya ca astreṇa tāḍayet
translated: Then, having sprinkled the disciple with Śiva water, he should strike with the weapon.

original: tenaiva cāstrabhūtena huṃphaṭkārayutena tu /🔽ātmano revakenaiva śiṣyadehe viśeddhṛdi // / //
analyzed: tena eva ca astra bhūtena huṃ phaṭkāra yutena tu  ātmanaḥ revakena eva śiṣya dehe viśet hṛdi
translated: And with that very weapon, along with the syllable hūṃ phaṭ,🔽he should enter the disciple's body in the heart with his own raṃ.

analyzed: astramantreṇa saṃchedya viśeṣa āśleṣya astreṇa karṣayet
translated: Having cut with the weapon mantra, he should draw with the weapon mantra that is to be conjoined with the specific [deity].

analyzed: dvādaśāntāt tu saṃgṛhya ātma stham pūrvavat kuru
translated: Having collected from the end of the twelve, make it in the self as before.

analyzed: pūrakeṇa atha saṃkumbhya recayitvā tu yojayet
translated: Having filled and bound, having exhaled, one should unite.

analyzed: pūrva vat dvyāpakam tasya caitanyam sarva yoniṣu
translated: As before, his consciousness pervades the two, in all wombs.

analyzed: yoga ādyam laya paryantam dhāmnā ca eva atra pūrvavat
translated: From yoga to the beginning, up to dissolution, and here with the dhāmanī as before.

analyzed: śikhayā śata homāt tu vidyāyāḥ niṣkṛtiḥ bhavet
translated: By offering a hundred oblations with the tuft, there will be atonement for the Vidyā.

original: praṇavādi tato rudram āvāhya sthāpya pūjayet /
analyzed: praṇava ādi tatas rudram āvāhya sthāpya pūjayet
translated: Then, having invoked Rudra with the Praṇava, having established, one should worship.

analyzed: vinyaset devi gandha rūpe dhruva āhutī
translated: Then, O Goddess, having deposited the gandharūpa, one should offer oblations with the syllable dhruva.
Having deposited a part of the puryaṣṭaka, having dismissed the deity Rudra,

analyzed: vāgīśīm ca visarjya evam kalā saṃdhiḥ ca pūrvavat
translated: and having dismissed Vāgīśī, the junction of the kalās is as before.

analyzed: hrasva dīrgha vibhāgena vidyām śāntau niyojayet
translated: One should engage the Vidyā in peace by the division of short and long.

analyzed: saṃdhāna artham tu mūlena juhuyāt āhuti trayam
translated: For the purpose of reconciliation, one should offer three oblations with the root.

analyzed: sva nāmnā āvāhanam śānteḥ vidhi pūrvam nivedanam
translated: The invocation of Śānti is with one's own name, the offering is preceded by the rules.

analyzed: prameya bhāvanām kṛtvā pūjayet kusuma ādibhiḥ
translated: Having performed the meditation on the object of knowledge, one should worship with flowers etc.

analyzed: tris āhutim tu mūlena vidyā tattvāt sadāśivam
translated: One should offer three oblations with the root, from the principle of Vidyā to Sadāśiva,

original: tattvānāṃ tritaye vyāptir varṇānāṃ traya eva ca // / //
analyzed: tattvānām tritaye vyāptiḥ varṇānām trayaḥ eva ca
translated: The pervasion of the principles is in three, and the letters are also three.

original: padaikādaśikā jñeyā purāṇi daśa sapta ca /
analyzed: pada ekādaśikā jñeyā purāṇi daśa sapta ca
translated: The group of eleven words should be known, and the cities are ten and seven.

original: mantrau dvau ṣaḍvidho 'dhvaivaṃ mukhyāḥ pāśā ime smṛtāḥ // / //
analyzed: mantrau dvau ṣaḍvidhaḥ mukhyāḥ pāśāḥ ime smṛtāḥ
translated: The two mantras, and the path is of six kinds - these knots are considered principal.

analyzed: sūkṣma pāśān anekān ca tad antar bhāvayet sadā
translated: And the subtle knots, which are many, he should always contemplate within them.

analyzed: vagīśīm kalpayet tatra pūrveṇa vidhinā āhutiḥ
translated: There he should imagine Vagisi, and the offering is according to the previous procedure.

analyzed: pūjanam mūlamantreṇa tatas prokṣaṇa tāḍanam
translated: Then the worship with the root mantra, the sprinkling and striking,

analyzed: cheda ākarṣa graham ca eva yoga dhāri tva janma ca
translated: The cutting, attraction, grasping, and the birth of the state of yoga and support -

analyzed: adhikāraḥ tathā bhogaḥ layaḥ vai pūrvavat bhavet
translated: The authority and enjoyment will be as before, and the dissolution will be as before.

original: sarve te mūlamantreṇa āhutitritayena tu // / //🔽niṣkṛtau śatahomaṃ tu kavacena tu kārayet /
analyzed: sarve te mūlamantreṇa āhuti tritayena tu  niṣkṛtau śata homam tu kavacena tu kārayet
translated: All of them are with the root mantra and with the three offerings.🔽In the expiation, one should perform the hundred oblations with the armor.

analyzed: viśleṣam pāśa chedam tu kuryāt astreṇa daiśikaḥ
translated: The preceptor should perform the separation and cutting of the knots with the weapon.

original: uddhārakaraṇātmastha tatsthīkārānbhavena tu /🔽svanāmnā praṇavādyena īśamāvāhya pūjayet // / //
analyzed: uddhāra karaṇa ātma stha tad sthīkāra anbhavena tu  sva nāmnā praṇava ādyena īśam āvāhya pūjayet
translated: The extraction, the self-abiding, and the abiding in that with existence,🔽Having invoked and worshipped the Lord with one's own name beginning with Om,

analyzed: saṃpūjya hutvā saṃtarpya
translated: Having worshipped, offered oblations, and gratified the parts of intellect, ego, and sense,

analyzed: sva nāmnā praṇava ādyam tu svāhā ante buddhim arpayet
translated: Having offered oblations with one's own name, preceded by Om and ending with Svāhā, one should dedicate one's intellect.

analyzed: ahaṃkāram tathā api evam hutvā idam kṣamayet tatas
translated: Having offered oblations in the same way to Ahamkāra (ego), one should then seek forgiveness.

analyzed: vāgīśīm pūjayitvā tu tarpayitvā visarjayet
translated: Having worshipped Vāgīśī (Goddess of Speech) and offered oblations, one should bid farewell.

analyzed: kalā saṃdhānakam pūrvam śānti atīte tu yojayet
translated: One should first perform the union of Kalās (parts) and then apply it to Śāntyatīta (the state beyond peace).

analyzed: hrasva dīrgha vibhāgena juhuyāt āhuti trayam
translated: One should offer three oblations by dividing the short and long (vowels).

analyzed: dhruveṇa tattva saṃdhānam kartavyam vidhi vedinā
translated: The union of principles should be done with Dhruva (Mantra) by one who knows the rules.

analyzed: kalā upasthāpanam paścāt dhruveṇa juhuyāt priye  tris āhuti prayogeṇa sva nāma padam uccaran
translated: O Beloved, one should then offer oblations with Dhruva for the installation of Kalās (parts).

original: śāntyatītāṃ samāvāhya sthāpayetpūjayetpunaḥ // / //🔽vyāptimālokya cādhvasthāṃ śivatattvagatāśca ye /

translated: Reciting one's own name, one should invoke Śāntyatīta (the state beyond peace) and establish it by the application of three oblations.🔽Having contemplated on the pervasion of the states of existence, and those who are in the Śiva principle,

analyzed: binduḥ nādaḥ tathā śaktiḥ śivatattve vyavasthitāḥ
translated: the Bindu (dot), Nāda (sound) and Śakti (power) are established in the Śiva principle.

original: padamekaṃ mantra eko varṇāḥ ṣoḍaśa kīrtitāḥ /🔽bhuvanāni tu sūkṣmāṇi śāntyatīte tu bhāvayet // / //
analyzed: padam ekam mantraḥ ekaḥ varṇāḥ ṣoḍaśa kīrtitāḥ  bhuvanāni tu sūkṣmāṇi śānti atīte tu bhāvayet
translated: One pada (word), one mantra (hymn), and sixteen letters are declared.🔽One should contemplate on the subtle worlds in Śāntyatīta (the state beyond peace).

analyzed: śodhanīyāḥ varārohe yāvat te śiva raśmayaḥ
translated: O beautiful lady, those Śiva rays of yours which are to be purified,

analyzed: śivasya ūrdhve śivaḥ jñeyaḥ yatra yuktaḥ na jāyate
translated: Above Śiva, Śiva should be known where one who is united is not born.

analyzed: kalāḥ ca pañca vijñeyāḥ tattva ṣaṭtriśat eva tu
translated: The kalās should be known as five, and the tattvas as thirty-six.

analyzed: sa caturviṃśati jñeyam bhuvanānām śata dvayam
translated: The worlds should be known as two hundred and twenty-four.

analyzed: ekāśīti padāni atra varṇa ardhaśatikā smṛtā
translated: Here, the pada-s are eighty-one, and the varṇa-s are remembered as one hundred and fifty.

analyzed: mantrāḥ ekādaśāḥ jñeyāḥ iti etat ca adhva maṇḍalam
translated: The mantras should be known as eleven - this is the circle of the paths.

analyzed: etasmin śuddhi māpane muktim āpnoti dīkṣitaḥ
translated: Having attained purity in this, the initiated one attains liberation.

analyzed: dhruveṇa āvāhya vāgīśīm vinyaset pūrvavat dhutiḥ
translated: Having invoked Vāgīśī with Dhruva, one should deposit as before, with the offering.

analyzed: saṃpūjya kusumādayiḥ tu tad yonau pūrvavat paśum
translated: Having worshipped with flowers etc., the animal as before in its yoni.

original: dhruveṇa sarvaṃ kartavyaṃ jananādilayāntakam /🔽niṣ /kṛtau śatahomaṃ tu mūlamantreṇa kalpayet // / //
analyzed: dhruveṇa sarvam kartavyam janana ādi laya antakam  niṣkṛtau śata homam tu mūlamantreṇa kalpayet

analyzed: viśleṣa pāśa chedābhyām prāgvat kuryāt dhruveṇa tu
translated: With Dhruva, one should perform the separation and cutting of the bonds as before.

analyzed: graheṇa ātma stha tad stha tvam praṇavena paśoḥ smṛtam
translated: The soul's abiding in the grasped and the grasper is remembered as being of Praṇava.

analyzed: sadāśivam atha āvāhya mūlamantram samuccaran
translated: Having invoked Sadāśiva, uttering the root mantra,

analyzed: namaskāreṇa saṃsthāpya puṣpaiḥ saṃpūjya tarpayet
translated: Having installed with salutations and worshipped with flowers, one should offer libations.

original: manaḥ puryaṣṭakāṃśaṃ tu vinyasetkāraṇeśvare /🔽praṇavādi samuccārya manaḥsaṃjñāṃ namastathā // / //
analyzed: manaḥ puryaṣṭaka aṃśam tu vinyaset kāraṇeśvare  praṇava ādi samuccārya manaḥ saṃjñām namaḥ tathā
translated: One should place the mind, which is a part of the eight constituents of the subtle body, in the Lord of causes.🔽Having uttered the Pranava (Om) and the name of the mind, one should offer salutations.

analyzed: vinyasya pūjayet paścāt saṃjñā svāhā antam eva ca
translated: Having placed, one should then worship with the name and the syllable Svaha.

analyzed: āhuti tritayam hutvā puryaṣṭa aṃśāt viśuddhi ati

analyzed: tatas visarjayet devam kāraṇam ca sadāśivam

analyzed: puṣpa ādibhiḥ samabhyarcya vāgīśīm tad anantaram
translated: Having worshipped with flowers etc., one should then worship the Goddess of Speech.

original: tā tu saṃpūjya saṃtarpya vijñāpyā bhaktibhāvitā /

translated: Having worshipped and offered libations to her, one should request her, being filled with devotion.

analyzed: kṣamasva devadeveśi paśu artham kheditā mayā

analyzed: idānīm nā uparoddhavyam gaccha devi sva viṣṭapam
translated: Now I should not obstruct you. Go, O Goddess, to your own abode.

original: visarjyaivaṃ kalā bhāvyā śāntyatītā layaṃ gatā // / //

translated: Having dismissed in this way, the Kalas should be dissolved into the state beyond peace.

translated: Existing in the state of subtle non-existence up to the support of one's own power,🔽One should offer one hundred oblations with one's own abode, by the division of the principle of the self.
One should offer oblations into the principle of the self by the union of uttering with the syllable Sa.

analyzed: māyā tattva avadhi jñeyam daiśikena mahā adhvare
translated: The knower should offer oblations up to the principle of Māyā in the great sacrificial rite.

analyzed: vidhi vaikalya karma artham prāyaścitta viśuddhaye
translated: For the sake of incomplete rituals and for the purification of expiations,

analyzed: sadāśiva antam adhvānam vidyā tattvam vinirdiśet
translated: The path ending with Sadāśiva is designated as the principle of Vidyā.

analyzed: mantra uccarava ulomena prāyaścittam tu yat bhavet

analyzed: manaḥ vijñāna vaikalyāt prāyaścittam tu yat bhavet
translated: The expiation that occurs due to the deficiency of mental knowledge,

analyzed: tad śuddhi artham śive tattve mūlamantreṇa homayet
translated: for its purification, one should offer oblations in the Śiva principle with the root mantra.

analyzed: mānasena prayogena śakti ante dhvani saṃsthitam

analyzed: tattva traya viśuddhi ante śikhā ācchedam tu kalpayet
translated: one should imagine the cutting of the tuft at the end of the purification of the three principles.

analyzed: adhva anta sthām parām śāntām anaupamyām anāmayām
translated: The supreme, tranquil one residing in the end of the path, incomparable, free from disease,

analyzed: vyāpinīm sarva tattvānām sarva kāraṇa kāraṇam
translated: pervading all principles, the cause of all causes,

translated: having contemplated her on the tuft of the disciple like a drop of water on the tip of a flower,

analyzed: kartarīm śikhayā āmantrya śikhayā chedayet śikhām

analyzed: śikhām samarpya ca anyasya nirgacchet sa sa śiṣyakaḥ  snānam samācaret śiṣyaḥ guroḥ ācamanam bhavet
translated: Having entrusted the tuft to another, he should go out with his disciple.🔽The disciple should perform the ablution, and the preceptor should perform the Ācamana.

analyzed: snānam uddhūlanam vā atha ācaret sva icchayā guruḥ
translated: The preceptor may perform the ablution or the smearing with dust as he pleases.

analyzed: praviśya sakalīkṛtya pūrṇayā juhuyāt śikhām

analyzed: hutvā nirgamya ca ācamya ā kṣālya sruc sruva kartarīḥ
translated: Having offered the oblation, gone out, performed Ācamana, and washed the Sruva, Sruva, and scissors,

analyzed: praviśya sakalīkṛtya śiva hasta anupūjanam
translated: having entered and made himself complete, he should worship the Śiva-hand.

analyzed: tatas tu maṇḍale paścāt pūjayet parameśvaram
translated: Then, in the Maṇḍala, he should worship the Supreme Lord.

analyzed: puṣpa ādibhiḥ aśeṣaiḥ tu tatas vijñāpayet śivam
translated: With all the flowers etc., he should then inform Śiva.

analyzed: bhagavan tvad prasādena adhva aṣṭaka vyavasthitam
translated: O Lord, by your grace, the Adhvaṣṭaka (eight paths) is established,

analyzed: paśum saṃgṛhya saṃśodhya śikhā cheda avasānakam
translated: having taken up the Paśu (individual soul) and purified it up to the cutting of the tuft,

analyzed: tvad mukha ukta vidhānam tu leśataḥ vartitam mayā
translated: I have performed a little of the procedure spoken by you,

analyzed: tvad śaktyā eva tu gantavyam āśu dhruva padam śivam
translated: but I must go quickly to the auspicious and firm state by your power alone.

analyzed: idānīm yojane karma tava ājñā anuvidhāyinaḥ
translated: Now, the rite of union for you who follow my instructions,
