analyzed: ājñā me dīyatām nātha śiṣyam saṃyojayāmi aham  labdha anujñātam ātmānam prahṛṣṭaḥ nirgataḥ purāt
translated: O Lord, grant me permission so that I can initiate the disciple.🔽Having obtained permission, he should joyfully come out of the city.

analyzed: ardha hastaḥ vrajet agnim śiṣyam āhūya prokṣayet
translated: He should walk half a cubit away from the fire and summon the disciple to sprinkle him.

analyzed: pūrvavat ca āsana sthasya sakalīkaraṇa ādikam
translated: As before, for one seated in the posture, the complete process of sanctification and so on,

analyzed: antaḥkaraṇa vinyāsam nāḍī saṃdhāna pūrvakam
translated: The arrangement of the inner organs preceded by the union of the channels,

original: pūjanaṃ tarpaṇaṃ cāgnau mantrāṇāṃ ca śivasya ca /
analyzed: pūjanam tarpaṇam ca agnau mantrāṇām ca śivasya ca
translated: The worship and offering of oblations into the fire of the mantras and of Shiva,

analyzed: daśa bhāga vibhāgena yathā dravya anusārataḥ  mantrān saṃśodhayet paścāt sakalīkaraṇe sthitān
translated: By dividing into ten parts according to the availability of materials,🔽One should then purify the mantras residing in the complete process of sanctification.

analyzed: sakṛt āhuti yogena adhikāraḥ vivarjyatām
translated: By the method of offering oblations once, may the authority be abandoned.

analyzed: sakalīkaraṇa tvena na kadācid paśoḥ punar
translated: By the nature of the complete process of sanctification, the animal should never again

original: yojanīyaṃ prayogaṃ tu adhunā kathayāmi te // / //
analyzed: yojanīyam prayogam tu adhunā kathayāmi te
translated: Be engaged. Now I shall tell you the application.

analyzed: jñātvā cāra pramāṇam tu prāṇa saṃcāram eva ca
translated: Having known the measure of conduct and the movement of the vital breath,

analyzed: ṣaḍvidha adhva vibhāgam tu prāṇa ekatra yathā sthitam
translated: The division of the sixfold path, and how the vital breath is situated in one place,

analyzed: haṃsa uccāram tu varṇaiḥ ca kāraṇa tyāgam eva ca
translated: The utterance of the Hamsa with the letters, and the abandonment of the cause,

analyzed: śūnyam samarasam jñeyam tyāgam saṃyogam udbhavam
translated: The empty, the homogeneous, the knowable, renunciation, union, and origination,

analyzed: bhedanam ca padārthānām bhāva prāpti vaśāt punar
translated: And the division of entities again by the power of attaining existence,

analyzed: ātma vidyā śiva vyāptim evam jñātvā tu yojayet
translated: Having known thus the pervasion of the self, knowledge, and Śiva, one should unite.

original: tadvibhāgaṃ pravakṣyāmi yathā jñāyeta tattvataḥ /🔽ṣaṭtriṃśadaṅgulaścāro hṛtpadmādyāvaśaktitaḥ // / //
analyzed: tad vibhāgam pravakṣyāmi yathā jñāyeta tattvataḥ  ṣaṭtriṃśat aṅgulaḥ cāraḥ hṛd padma ādyau aśaktitaḥ
translated: I will explain its division so that it may be known as it truly is.🔽The movement is thirty-six finger-breadths from the heart lotus up to the end of the power,

analyzed: tuṭi ṣoḍaśa mānena kālena kalitaḥ priye
translated: Measured by the time of sixteen tuțis, O beloved.

analyzed: saṃcarantam vibhāgena yathāvat tam śṛṇuṣva me
translated: Listen to me as I explain its movement by division as it truly is.

analyzed: hṛd padma ādi yāvat ayanam bhāgam ekam tyajet tu saḥ
translated: He should abandon one part from the heart lotus up to the end of the path,

original: nāsikāgre dvitīyaṃ tu śaktyante tu tṛtīyakam // / //🔽tatrastho vinivarteta yāvattattvaṃ na vindati /
analyzed: nāsikā agre dvitīyam tu śakti ante tu tṛtīyakam  tatrasthaḥ vinivarteta yāvat tattvam na vindati
translated: The second at the tip of the nose, and the third at the end of the power.🔽Dwelling there, he should return until he finds the truth.

original: vidite tu pare tattve tatrastho 'pi na bādhyate // / //
analyzed: vidite tu pare tattve tatrasthaḥ na bādhyate
translated: But when the supreme truth is known, even dwelling there he is not obstructed.

original: śaktyā cādho yadā gacched abudhastu tadā bhavet /🔽hṛdgataḥ punaruttiṣṭhed budhyamānaḥ sa ucyate // / //
analyzed: śaktyā ca adhas yadā gacchet abudhaḥ tu tadā bhavet  hṛd gataḥ punar uttiṣṭhet budhyamānaḥ saḥ ucyate
translated: When the ignorant one moves down by the power, he becomes then.🔽Returning from the heart, he is said to be awakened.

original: śaktiṃ prāpya budho jñeyaḥ vyāpinyaṃśe prabuddhatā /
analyzed: śaktim prāpya budhaḥ jñeyaḥ vyāpinī aṃśe prabuddha tā
translated: The wise one should be known as having reached the power, and the state of being awakened in the all-pervading part.

analyzed: atītaḥ su prabuddhaḥ tu unmanaḥ tvam tadā bhavet
translated: The past is Suprabuddha, then there is Unmanastva (state of being beyond the mind).

original: na kālo na kalā cāro na tattvaṃ naca kāraṇam /
analyzed: na kālaḥ na kalā cāraḥ na tattvam na ca kāraṇam
translated: There is no time, no Kala (parts of time), no Char (motion), no tattva (principle), no cause,

analyzed: su nirvāṇam param śuddham guru pāramparā gatam
translated: The supreme, pure, well-extinguished (nirvana), which has come down through the lineage of gurus,

original: tadvoditvā vimucyeta gatvā bhūyo na jāyate /
analyzed: tat vā uditvā vimucyeta gatvā bhūyas na jāyate
translated: Having arisen from that, one is liberated, having gone, one is not born again.

original: adhvaṣṭkaṃ yathā prāṇe saṃsthitaṃ kathayāmi te // / //🔽āpādānmūrdhaparyantaṃ citeḥ saṃvedanaṃ hi yat /
analyzed: adhvaṣṭkam yathā prāṇe saṃsthitam kathayāmi te  ā pādāt mūrdha paryantam citeḥ saṃvedanam hi yat
translated: I shall tell you how the group of eight paths is situated in the life force.🔽From the feet up to the head, whatever is the consciousness of consciousness,

original: bhuvanādhvā sa vijñeyas tattvādhvā ca tathaiva hi // / //
analyzed: bhuvana adhvā sa vijñeyaḥ tattva adhvā ca tathā eva hi
translated: That should be known as the world path and also as the principle path.

analyzed: kalā kalita saṃtānaḥ prāṇaḥ saṃcarate sadā
translated: The life force, which is the series modified by the kalas, always moves.

analyzed: nivṛttiḥ ca pratiṣṭhā ca adhobhāge pravartike
translated: Nivritti and Prathishtha are in the lower part, and Pravritti is in the middle.

analyzed: vidyā śāntiḥ tathā ca ūrdhve śānti atītā tu adhiṣṭhikā
translated: Vidyā, Shānti, and also above is Shāntyatirikta, which is the support.

analyzed: tad atītaḥ paraḥ bhāvaḥ tad ūrdhvam padam avyayam
translated: Beyond that is the supreme state, above that is the imperishable state.

analyzed: evam bindu kalāḥ jñeyāḥ nāda śakti ātmikāḥ ca yāḥ
translated: Thus the bindu kalas should be known, and those which are of the nature of nada and shakti,

analyzed: vyāpinī ādi ātmikāḥ yāḥ ca vyāpya vyāpaka bhedataḥ
translated: And those which are of the nature of Vyapinī and others, by the distinction of the pervaded and the pervader.

analyzed: prāṇa eka saṃsthitāḥ sarvāḥ ṣaṣ tyāgāt saptame layaḥ
translated: All of them are situated in the life force alone. By the renunciation of the six, there is dissolution in the seventh.

analyzed: kalā adhvā evam samākhyātaḥ varṇādhvānam nibodha me
translated: Thus the path of energies has been described. Now listen to me about the path of letters from me.

analyzed: varṇāḥ śabda ātmakāḥ sarve jagati asmin carācare
translated: All letters are of the nature of sound, existing in this world of moving and unmoving beings.

original: sthitāḥ pañcaśatā bhedaiḥ śāstreṣvānantyakoṭiṣu // / //🔽śabdātprāṇaḥ samākhyātas tasmādvarṇāstu prāṇataḥ /🔽utpadyante layaṃ yānti yatra śabdo layaṃ gataḥ // / //
analyzed: sthitāḥ pañcaśatāḥ bhedaiḥ śāstreṣu ānantya koṭiṣu  śabdāt prāṇaḥ samākhyātaḥ tasmāt varṇāḥ tu prāṇataḥ  utpadyante layam yānti yatra śabdaḥ layam gataḥ
translated: They are present in five hundred divisions in the scriptures with countless millions.🔽From sound, life force is said to arise, and from that, letters arise from life force.🔽They arise and dissolve back into where sound dissolves.

analyzed: śabda atītaḥ varārohe tattvena saha yujyate
translated: O beautiful lady, what is beyond sound is united with reality.

analyzed: yuktaḥ sarva gataḥ devi dharma adharma vivarjitaḥ
translated: United, all-pervading, O Goddess, free from virtue and vice.

original: nādho nirīkṣate bhūyaḥ śivatattvaṃ gato yadā /
analyzed: na adhas nirīkṣate bhūyas śivatattvam gataḥ yadā
translated: When one has attained the reality of Shiva, one does not look down again.

analyzed: adhas vai yāti adharmeṇa dharmeṇa ūrdhvam vrajet punar
translated: One goes down through vice and up again through virtue.

analyzed: vijñānena dvayam tyaktvā sarvagaḥ tu bhavet iha
translated: Through knowledge, one abandons the two and becomes all-pervading here.

analyzed: varṇādhvā evam samākhyātaḥ padādhvā procyate dhunā
translated: Thus the path of letters has been described. Now the path of words is being spoken of.

analyzed: ekāśīti padāni eva vidyārāja sthitāni api
translated: There are eighty-one words, which are also present in the king of knowledge.

analyzed: varṇa ātmakāni tāni atra varṇāḥ prāṇa ātmakāḥ sthitāḥ
translated: They are of the nature of letters, and here the letters are present in the form of life force.

analyzed: tasmāt evam padāni atra tāni prāṇa krameṇa tu
translated: Therefore, here the words are in the sequence of life force.

analyzed: padādhvā evam samākhyātaḥ mantrādhvānam nibodha me
translated: Thus the path of words has been explained. Understand from me the path of mantras.

original: mantrikādaśikā yā tu sā ca haṃse vyavasthitā /
analyzed: yā tu sā ca haṃse vyavasthitā
translated: The group of ten mantras is established in the Hamsa.

original: padikādaśikā sā ca prāṇe carati nityaśaḥ // / //🔽akāraśca ukāraśca makāro bindureva ca /
analyzed: sā ca prāṇe carati nityaśas  akāraḥ ca ukāraḥ ca makāraḥ binduḥ eva ca
translated: That group of ten words always moves in the vital breath.🔽The letter A, the letter U, the letter M, and the Bindu,

original: ardhacandro nirodhī ca nādo nādānta eva ca // / //
analyzed: ardhacandraḥ nirodhī ca nādaḥ nādāntaḥ eva ca
translated: The half-moon, the stopper, the sound, and the end of the sound,

analyzed: śaktiḥ ca vyāpinī ca eva samanā ekādaśī smṛtā
translated: The power, the all-pervading, and the eleventh of the mind are remembered.

original: unmanā ca tato 'tītā tadatītaṃ nirāmayam // / //🔽mantrā evaṃ sthitāḥ prāṇe haṃsoccārastathocyate /
analyzed: unmanā ca tītā tad atītam nirāmayam  mantrāḥ evam sthitāḥ prāṇe haṃsa uccāraḥ tathā ucyate
translated: The Transmental is beyond that, and beyond that is the taintless transcendence.🔽The mantras are thus situated in the vital breath. The utterance of Hamsa is explained thus.

original: hakārastu smṛtaḥ prāṇaḥ svapravṛtto halākṛtiḥ // / //🔽akāreṇa yadā yukta ukāracaraṇena tu /
analyzed: hakāraḥ tu smṛtaḥ prāṇaḥ sva pravṛttaḥ ha la ākṛtiḥ  akāreṇa yadā yuktaḥ ukāra caraṇena tu
translated: The letter Ha is remembered as the vital breath, self-moving, in the form of a hook.🔽When united with the letter A and the foot of the letter U,

analyzed: makāra mātrayā yuktaḥ varṇa uccāraḥ bhavet sphuṭaḥ
translated: The utterance of the letter M becomes clear.

analyzed: binduḥ śiraḥ samāyogāt su svara tvam prapadyate
translated: The Bindu, by the union with the head, attains a good sound.

analyzed: nādaḥ sya vadanam proktaḥ vadanam śabdam īrayet
translated: The sound is said to be its face, the face emits sound.

original: anenaiva ca yogena haṃsaḥ puruṣa ucyate /
analyzed: anena eva ca yogena haṃsaḥ puruṣaḥ ucyate
translated: By this very yoga, the Hamsa is said to be the Purusha.

analyzed: brahma viṣṇu īśa mārgeṇa caran vai sarva jantuṣu
translated: Moving along the path of Brahma, Vishnu, and Ishvara, among all beings,

analyzed: śakti tattve layam yāti vijñānena ūrdhva tām vrajet
translated: Dissolves into the principle of Shakti and attains upward movement through knowledge.

analyzed: vyāpinīm samanām tyaktvā vrajet unmanayā śivam
translated: Abandoning the all-pervading and the equalizing breath, one should go to Shiva with the upward-moving breath.

original: śivatattvagato haṃso na caret vyāpako bhavet /
analyzed: śivatattva gataḥ haṃsaḥ na caret vyāpakaḥ bhavet
translated: The swan abiding in the principle of Shiva should not move but become all-pervading.

analyzed: haṃsa uccāraḥ samākhyātaḥ kāraṇaiḥ ca samanvitaḥ
translated: The utterance of the swan is said to be endowed with causes.

analyzed: hakāraḥ prāṇa śakti ātmā akāraḥ brahma vācakaḥ
translated: The letter ha is the essence of the power of life-force, and the letter a denotes Brahman.

analyzed: hṛdi tyāgaḥ bhavet tasya ukāraḥ viṣṇu vācakaḥ
translated: Its abandonment should be in the heart. The letter u denotes Vishnu.

analyzed: kaṇṭhe tyāgaḥ bhavet tasya makāraḥ rudra vācakaḥ
translated: Its abandonment should be in the throat. The letter ma denotes Rudra.

analyzed: tālu madhye tyajet tam tu binduḥ ca eva īśvaraḥ svayam
translated: One should abandon it in the middle of the palate. The dot is Ishvara himself.

analyzed: tyāgaḥ tatra bhruvoḥ madhye nāde vācyaḥ sadāśivaḥ
translated: Its abandonment is in the middle of the eyebrows. Sadashiva should always be spoken of in the sound.

analyzed: lalāṭāt mūrdha paryantam tyāgaḥ tasya vidhīyate
translated: Its abandonment is from the forehead up to the head.
The imperishable Shiva is the one to be expressed of Shakti, the all-pervading, and the equalizing breath.

analyzed: mūrdha madhye tyajet śaktim tad ūrdhve vyāpinīm tyajet
translated: One should abandon Shakti in the middle of the head, and above that, one should abandon the all-pervading.

analyzed: samanām unmanām tyaktvā ṣaṣ tyāgāt saptame layaḥ
translated: Having abandoned the equalizing and upward-moving breaths, by the abandonment of six, there is dissolution in the seventh.

analyzed: sūkṣma sūkṣmataraiḥ bhāvaiḥ evam evam tyajet priye
translated: In this way, O beloved, one should abandon the subtle and subtler states.

original: sthūlasthūlatarairbhāvair nānāsiddhiphalapradaiḥ /🔽sūkṣmo 'tyantaṃ paro bhāvas tv abhāvaḥ sa vidhīyate // / //
analyzed: sthūla sthūlataraiḥ bhāvaiḥ nānā siddhi phala pradaiḥ  paraḥ bhāvaḥ tu abhāvaḥ sa vidhīyate
translated: By means of the gross and grosser states, which bestow various accomplishments and fruits,🔽The subtlest and supreme state is declared to be non-existence.

analyzed: unmanā tu aparaḥ bhāvaḥ sthūlaḥ tasya aparaḥ mataḥ
translated: The Transmental is another state, and it is considered to be grosser than that.

original: tasyāparaṃ punaḥ śūnyaṃ saṃsparśaṃ ca tato 'param // / //
analyzed: tasya aparam punar śūnyam saṃsparśam ca param
translated: Beyond that is emptiness, and beyond that is contact.

original: śabdo jyotiḥ tato mantrāḥ kāraṇā bhuvanāni ca /
analyzed: śabdaḥ jyotiḥ tatas mantrāḥ kāraṇāḥ bhuvanāni ca
translated: Sound, light, then the mantras, the causes, and the worlds,

analyzed: pañcabhūta ātma bhuvanam kāraṇaiḥ samadhiṣṭhitam
translated: The world consisting of the five elements is presided over by the causes.

analyzed: bhuvanam cintayet yaḥ tu vakṣyamāṇa eka rūpakam
translated: One who contemplates the world, which is described by the following characteristics,

analyzed: bhuvaneśa tvam āpnoti śivam dhyātvā tu tad mayaḥ
translated: Attains lordship over the world and, meditating on Śiva, becomes identified with Him.

analyzed: brahma ādi kāraṇānām ca sādhane vigraham smaran
translated: Remembering the embodied form of Brahmā and the other causes in their creation,

analyzed: pūrva ukta lakṣaṇam yaḥ ca tanmaya tvam avāpnuyāt
translated: One who possesses the previously mentioned characteristics attains identity with them.

analyzed: mantriḥ ca mantra siddhiḥ tu japa homa arcanāt bhavet
translated: And the reciter, by means of japa, homa, and worship, attains success in the mantra.

analyzed: pūrva ukta rūpaka dhyānāt siddhi anti atra na saṃśayaḥ
translated: By meditating on the form described earlier, they attain success here, there is no doubt.

analyzed: jyotiḥ dhyānāt tu yogi indraḥ yoga siddhim avāpnuyāt
translated: But by meditating on the light, the lord of yogis will attain perfection in yoga.

analyzed: tad maya tvam yat āpnoti yoginām adhipaḥ bhavet
translated: When he attains oneness with it, he becomes the lord of yogis.

analyzed: śabda dhyānāt ca śabda ātmā vāc maya āpūrakaḥ bhavet
translated: And by meditating on sound, he becomes the soul of sound and fills the universe with speech.

analyzed: sparśa dhyānāt ca sparśa ātmā jagataḥ kāraṇam bhavet
translated: And by meditating on touch, he becomes the soul of touch and the cause of the universe.

analyzed: śūnya dhyānāt ca śūnya ātmā vyāpī sarva gataḥ bhavet
translated: And by meditating on emptiness, he becomes the empty-souled, all-pervading, and omnipresent.

analyzed: samana dhyāna yogena yogī sarvajña tām vrajet
translated: By the yoga of meditation on equanimity, the yogi attains omniscience.

original: unmanyā tu paraṃ sūkṣmam abhāvaṃ bhāvayetsadā /
analyzed: unmanyā tu param sūkṣmam abhāvam bhāvayet sadā
translated: But by the unmanifest, one should always contemplate the supreme, subtle, non-existence.

analyzed: sarva indriya manaḥ utītaḥ tu alakṣyaḥ bhāvaḥ ucyate
translated: The imperceptible non-existence is said to be beyond all senses and mind.

original: abhāvaṃ bhāvyaṃ bhāvena bhāvaṃ kṛtvā nirāśrayam /
analyzed: abhāvam bhāvyam bhāvena bhāvam kṛtvā nirāśrayam
translated: Having contemplated non-existence with existence, making existence without support,

analyzed: sarva upādhi vinirmuktam abhāvam labhate padam
translated: one attains the state of non-existence, free from all limitations.

original: eṣa te kāraṇatyāgaḥ kālatyāgaṃ nibodha me /
analyzed: eṣa te kāraṇa tyāgaḥ kāla tyāgam nibodha me
translated: This is the renunciation of causes. Understand from me the renunciation of time.

original: tuṭiṣoḍaśasaṃyuktaḥ prāṇastu samudāhṛtaḥ // / //🔽tuṭadvayaṃ samāśritya ekaiko bhairavaḥ sthitaḥ /
analyzed: tuṭi ṣoḍaśa saṃyuktaḥ prāṇaḥ tu samudāhṛtaḥ  tuṭa dvayam samāśritya ekaikaḥ bhairavaḥ sthitaḥ
translated: The life force is said to be endowed with sixteen moments.🔽Each Bhairava resides in two moments.

analyzed: ahar rātra vibhāgena kurvanti udayam eva te
translated: They rise by the division of day and night.

analyzed: navamaḥ tu paraḥ devaḥ tejasaḥ tu udayanti te
translated: The ninth is the supreme God, from whom all these luminaries arise.

analyzed: sarvam kālam tyajet prāṇe yathāvat kathayāmi te
translated: One should abandon all time in the vital breath. I shall tell you accurately.

original: tuṭayaḥ ṣoḍaśaivoktāḥ kālasya karaṇaṃ tu tāḥ /
analyzed: tuṭayaḥ ṣoḍaśa eva uktāḥ kālasya karaṇam tu tāḥ
translated: The sixteen tuṭis are said to be the measure of time.

original: tadādiḥ saṃsthitaḥ kālaḥ sarvaṃ carati vāṅmayam // / //🔽tuṭirlavo nimeṣaśca kāṣṭhā caiva kalā tathā /
analyzed: tad ādiḥ saṃsthitaḥ kālaḥ sarvam carati vāc mayam  tuṭiḥ lavaḥ nimeṣaḥ ca kāṣṭhā ca eva kalā tathā
translated: Time begins from there, and all that is expressed moves.🔽Tuṭi, lava, nimeṣa, kāṣṭhā, kalā,

analyzed: muhūrtaḥ ca api ahar rātraḥ pakṣaḥ māsaḥ ṛtuḥ tathā
translated: muhūrta, day and night, pakṣa, month, season,

analyzed: ayanam vatsaraḥ ca eva yugam manvantaram tathā
translated: ayana, year, yuga, Manu-antara,

analyzed: kalpaḥ ca eva mahākalpaḥ śakti ante tam parityajet
translated: kalpa, and mahākalpa - one should abandon that at the end of Śakti.

original: vyāpinyante paraḥ kālaḥ sa tadaṅgī tyajettu tam /
analyzed: vyāpinī ante paraḥ kālaḥ sa tad aṅgī tyajet tu tam
translated: At the end of Vyāpinī, the supreme time is merged there, and one should abandon that.

original: sa ca saptadaśo jñeyaḥ parārdhaparataḥ sthitaḥ // / //
analyzed: sa ca saptadaśaḥ jñeyaḥ parārdha paratas sthitaḥ
translated: That should be known as the seventeenth, situated beyond the parārdha.

analyzed: parārdhaḥ corr
translated: Parārdha

original: so 'pi cāṣṭādaśo devi samanānte tu taṃ tyajet /
analyzed: ca aṣṭādaśaḥ devi samana ante tu tam tyajet
translated: That also is the eighteenth, O Goddess, one should abandon it at the end of Samanā.

analyzed: sarvakālam tu kālasya vyāpakaḥ paramaḥ vyayaḥ
translated: The supreme, imperishable pervader of all time is beyond time.

original: unmanyante pare yojyo na kālastatra vidyate /
analyzed: unmanyante pare yojyaḥ na kālaḥ tatra vidyate
translated: One should be united with the supreme at the end of Unmanā, where there is no time.

original: nityo nityodito vyāpī ādirūpaṃ na saṃtyajet // / //
analyzed: nityaḥ nitya uditaḥ vyāpī ādi rūpam na saṃtyajet
translated: The eternal, ever-arisen, all-pervading, primordial form should not be abandoned.

original: taṃ ca nityoditaṃ prāpya tanmayo jāyate sadā /
analyzed: tam ca nitya uditam prāpya tad mayaḥ jāyate sadā
translated: Having attained that which is ever-rising, one always becomes absorbed in it.

analyzed: kāla tyāgaḥ bhavet evam śūnya bhāvaḥ tu atha ucyate
translated: Thus, the abandonment of time occurs. Now, the state of emptiness is being described.

analyzed: ūrdhva śūnyam adhas śūnyam madhya śūnyam tṛtīyakam
translated: The upper emptiness, the lower emptiness, and the third, the middle emptiness,

original: śūnyatrayaṃ calaṃ hyetat tadadho madhya ūrdhvataḥ // / //
analyzed: śūnya trayam calam hi etat tat adhas madhye ūrdhvatas
translated: this triad of emptinesses is indeed mobile, below that, in the middle and above.

analyzed: caturtham vyāpinī śūnyam samanāyām ca pañcamam
translated: The fourth is the all-pervading emptiness, and the fifth is in the samana,

original: unmanāyāṃ tathā ṣaṣṭhaṃ ṣaḍete sāmayāḥ sthitāḥ // / //
analyzed: unmanāyām tathā ṣaṣṭham ṣaṭ ete sa āmayāḥ sthitāḥ
translated: and likewise the sixth is in the unmana. These six are present in the samayas.

analyzed: tattvena adhiṣṭhitāḥ sarve sa āmayāḥ api siddhi dāḥ
translated: All the samayas are indeed bestowers of success, presided over by that principle.

original: ṣaṭ śūnyāni parityajya saptame tu layaṃ kuru // / //
analyzed: ṣaḍ śūnyāni parityajya saptame tu layam kuru
translated: Having abandoned the six emptinesses, one should merge into the seventh.

analyzed: tat śūnyam tu param sūkṣmam sarva avasthā vivarjitam
translated: That emptiness is indeed supreme, subtle, devoid of all states,

analyzed: a śūnyam śūnyam iti uktam śūnyam ca abhāvaḥ ucyate
translated: it is said to be non-empty emptiness, and emptiness is said to be non-existence.

original: abhāvaḥ sa samuddiṣṭo yatra bhāvāḥ kṣayaṃ gatāḥ /
analyzed: abhāvaḥ sa samuddiṣṭaḥ yatra bhāvāḥ kṣayam gatāḥ
translated: Non-existence is indeed indicated, where existences have been destroyed.

original: sattāmātraṃ paraṃ śāntaṃ tatpadaṃ kimapi sthitam // / //
analyzed: sattā mātram param śāntam tat padam kim api sthitam
translated: Existence alone, supreme peace, that state abides in some way.

original: yatra yatra ca nādādi sthūlā anye 'pi saṃsthitāḥ /
analyzed: yatra yatra ca nāda ādi sthūlāḥ anye saṃsthitāḥ
translated: And wherever the gross sounds and others are present,

original: tatra tatra paraṃ śūnyaṃ sarvaṃ vyāpya vyavasthitam // / //
analyzed: tatra tatra param śūnyam sarvam vyāpya vyavasthitam
translated: There, in each place, the supreme emptiness abides, pervading everything.

analyzed: tat eva bhavati sthūlam sthūla upādhi vaśāt priye
translated: O Beloved, that alone becomes gross due to the influence of gross limiting adjuncts.

analyzed: sthūla sūkṣma prabhedena tat ekam saṃvyavasthitam
translated: That one is established in convention by the division into gross and subtle.

original: tatprāpya tanmayatvaṃ ca labhate nātra saṃśayaḥ /
analyzed: tat prāpya tad maya tvam ca labhate na atra saṃśayaḥ
translated: Having attained that, one certainly attains identity with that.

analyzed: śūnya bhāvaḥ samākhyātaḥ sāmarasyam nibodha me
translated: The state of emptiness has been explained. Understand the state of oneness with me.

analyzed: ātmani ekaḥ samarasaḥ mantre jñeyaḥ dvitīyakaḥ
translated: The first is the oneness in the self, the second should be known in the mantra.

analyzed: tṛtīyam nāḍi gam kuryāt śaktau kuryāt caturthakam
translated: The third should be made in the nāḍī, and the fourth should be made in the śakti.

original: vyāpinyāṃ pañcamaṃ proktaṃ samanāyāṃ tu ṣaṣṭhakam /
analyzed: vyāpinyām pañcamam proktam samanāyām tu ṣaṣṭhakam
translated: The fifth is said to be in the all-pervading, and the sixth in the samāna.

original: tātvaḥ samaraso devi saptamastu vidhīyate // / //🔽śiṣyātmānaṃ tu saṃgṛhya pūrvoktavidhinā kramāt /
analyzed: samarasaḥ devi saptamaḥ tu vidhīyate  śiṣya ātmānam tu saṃgṛhya pūrva ukta vidhinā kramāt
translated: O Goddess, the seventh is prescribed to be the oneness in the tattva.🔽Having collected the disciple's self in the previously mentioned order,

analyzed: paścāt ātmani saṃyojya lolībhūtam vicintayet
translated: and then uniting it with the self, one should contemplate it as merged in the līlā.

analyzed: pūrakam kumbhakam kṛtvā samānena nirodhayet
translated: Having performed the filling and holding, one should stop it with the samāna.

analyzed: yāvatyaḥ nāḍayaḥ devi tiryak ūrdhvam adhas sthitāḥ
translated: O Goddess, as many nāḍīs as there are, situated horizontally, above and below,

analyzed: samānena samākṛṣṭāḥ ekībhūtāḥ bhavanti tāḥ
translated: they are drawn together by the samāna and become one.

analyzed: tāsu ye vāyavaḥ te pi prāṇe samarasī gatāḥ
translated: And the winds that are in them also merge into the vital breath.

analyzed: nāḍayaḥ tu suṣumnāyām ekībhūtāḥ vyavasthitāḥ
translated: The channels, however, become unified and established in the suṣumnā.

original: tato vai uccarenmantraḥ nāde līnaṃ vicintayet // / //
analyzed: tatas vai uccaret mantraḥ nāde līnam vicintayet
translated: Then the mantra should be uttered and contemplated as dissolved in the nāda.

original: mantra ātmā tathā nāḍī evaṃ samarasībhavet /
analyzed: mantra ātmā tathā nāḍī evam samarasībhavet
translated: The mantra, the self, and the channel thus become merged together.

analyzed: vāma dakṣiṇa madhye tu tatas nādam pramocayet
translated: Then the nāda should be released in the left, right, and middle.

original: setubandhaṃ ca taṃ mārgaṃ yatra gatvā na jāyate /
analyzed: setu bandham ca tam mārgam yatra gatvā na jāyate
translated: That path is the bridge, going where one is not born.

original: brahmā viṣṇuśca rudraśca īśvaraḥ śiva eva ca // / //
analyzed: brahmā viṣṇuḥ ca rudraḥ ca īśvaraḥ śivaḥ eva ca
translated: Brahmā, Viṣṇu, Rudra, Īśvara, and Śiva

original: ete 'tra samatāṃ yānti anyathā tu pṛthak pṛthak /
analyzed: ete tra samatām yānti anyathā tu pṛthak pṛthak
translated: all become equal here, otherwise they are separate.

analyzed: tasmin samuccaret nādam yāvat śaktau layam gataḥ
translated: In that, the nāda should be uttered until it dissolves into Śakti.

analyzed: śakti madhya gataḥ nādaḥ śakti ātmā tu vidhīyate
translated: The nāda located in the middle of Śakti is said to be of the nature of Śakti.

analyzed: sarvam śakti mayam tatra sarvam samarasībhavet
translated: Everything there is full of Śakti, everything becomes merged together.

original: tadūrdhvaṃ vyāpinīṃ prāpya sarvaṃ tanmayatāṃ vrajet /
analyzed: tad ūrdhvam vyāpinīm prāpya sarvam tad maya tām vrajet
translated: Above that, having reached the all-pervading, everything becomes of its nature.

analyzed: samantāt vyāpnuyāt yasmāt vyāpinī iti abhidhīyate
translated: It is called all-pervading because it pervades everywhere.

analyzed: tad ūrdhvam samanām vyāpya tanmaya tvam vrajet punar
translated: Above that, having pervaded the equalizing, it again becomes of its nature.

original: sā ca sarvagatā jñeyā sāmarasyena saṃsthitā // / //
analyzed: sā ca sarva gatā jñeyā sāmarasyena saṃsthitā
translated: And that should be known as all-pervading, existing in a state of non-duality.

original: ṣaṣṭhaṃ samarasaṃ tyaktvā saptamaṃ tu tato vrajet /
analyzed: ṣaṣṭham sama rasam tyaktvā saptamam tu tatas vrajet
translated: Having abandoned the sixth, the state of equal taste, one should then proceed to the seventh.

original: taṃ prāpya tanmayatvaṃ hi nātra kāryā vicāraṇā // / //🔽sa ca sarveṣu bhūteṣu bhāvatatvendriyeṣu ca /
analyzed: tam prāpya tad maya tvam hi na atra kāryā vicāraṇā  sa ca sarveṣu bhūteṣu ca
translated: Having attained that, one becomes absorbed in it. No doubt should be entertained in this matter.🔽And that is present in all beings, in the principles of existence, and in the senses,

analyzed: sthāvaram jaṅgamam ca eva cetana acetana sthitam
translated: in the immovable and the moving, in what is sentient and insentient.

original: adhvānaṃ vyāpya sarvaṃ tu sāmarasyena saṃsthitaḥ /
analyzed: adhvānam vyāpya sarvam tu sāmarasyena saṃsthitaḥ
translated: Pervading the entire path, it exists in a state of non-duality.

analyzed: prasahya cañcalī iti eva yoginām api yat manaḥ
translated: Even the mind of yogis is fickle, moving about.

original: yasya jñeyamayo bhāvaḥ sthiraḥ pūrṇaḥ samantataḥ /
analyzed: yasya jñeya mayaḥ bhāvaḥ sthiraḥ pūrṇaḥ samantataḥ
translated: For one whose firm and complete nature is made of the knowable,

original: mano na calate tasya sarvāvasthāgatasya tu // / //
analyzed: manaḥ na calate tasya sarva avasthā gatasya tu
translated: the mind does not move, even when in all states.

original: yatra yatra mano yāti jñeyaṃ tatraiva cintayet /
analyzed: yatra yatra manaḥ yāti jñeyam tatra eva cintayet
translated: Wherever the mind goes, one should contemplate the knowable there itself.

original: calitvā yāsyate kutra sarvaṃ śivamayaṃ yataḥ // / //
analyzed: calitvā yāsyate kutra sarvam śiva mayam yatas
translated: Having moved, where will it go? Since everything is full of Śiva.

original: viṣayeṣu ca sarveṣu indriyārtheṣu ca sthitaḥ /
analyzed: viṣayeṣu ca sarveṣu indriyārtheṣu ca sthitaḥ
translated: Abiding in all the objects of sense and in the objects of the senses,

original: yatra yatra nirūpyeta nāśivaṃ vidyate kvacit // / //
analyzed: yatra yatra nirūpyeta na aśivam vidyate kvacid
translated: wherever it is observed, nothing is found to be inauspicious.

original: evāṃ samarasaṃ jñātvā nāsau muhyet kadācana /
analyzed: evam samarasam jñātvā na asau muhyet kadācana
translated: Knowing thus the state of equal taste, one is never deluded.

original: yasyaivaṃ sarvato bhāvaḥ so 'pi sarvagato bhavet // / //
analyzed: yasya evam sarvatas bhāvaḥ saḥ u sarva gataḥ bhavet
translated: He who has such an all-pervading nature would also be all-pervading.

original: evaṃ samarasaḥ prokto viṣuvattu nibodha me /
analyzed: evam samarasaḥ proktaḥ viṣuvat tu nibodha me
translated: Thus, the state of equal taste has been described. Now listen to me about the equinox.

analyzed: prathamam prāṇa viṣuvat mātram jñeyam dvitīyakam
translated: The first equinox is to be known as the breath, the second as the measure,

analyzed: tṛtīyam nāḍi viṣuvat praśāntam ca caturthakam
translated: The third as the equinox of the channels, and the fourth as the tranquil one.

original: pañcamaṃ śaktiviṣuvat ṣaṣṭhaṃ vai kāla ucyate // / //
analyzed: pañcamam śakti viṣuvat ṣaṣṭham vai kālaḥ ucyate
translated: The fifth is the equinox of power, and the sixth is said to be time,

analyzed: tattva viṣuvat pravibhāgaḥ tu atha ucyate
translated: The seventh is the equinox of the principles. Now the division is being told.

original: ātmānaṃ ca manaḥ prāṇe saṃyojya viṣuvadbhavet // / //
analyzed: ātmānam ca manaḥ prāṇe saṃyojya viṣuvant bhavet
translated: Having united the self and the mind with the breath, it becomes the equinox.

analyzed: prāṇe viṣuvat ākhyātam māntram viṣuvat ucyate
translated: The equinox in the breath has been described. Now the equinox of the mantra is being told.

analyzed: mantram uccārayet tāvat yāvat na anya manāḥ bhavet
translated: One should utter the mantra as long as the mind does not turn to anything else.

analyzed: para apara vibhāgena mantra ātmā tu tat ucyate
translated: The self of the mantra is said to be that by the division of the higher and the lower.

analyzed: māntram viṣuvat iti uktam nāḍi stham tat nibodha me
translated: The equinox of the mantra has been described. Now listen to me about the equinox of the channels.

analyzed: sarvāsām eva nāḍīnām madhye yā saṃvyavasthitā
translated: Among all the channels, the one that is situated in the middle,

original: suṣumnā nāma sā jñeyā nābheḥ śaktyā śivaṃ gatā // / //
analyzed: suṣumnā nāma sā jñeyā nābheḥ śaktyā śivam gatā
translated: Should be known as Susumna, which has gone to Shiva by the power from the navel.

analyzed: tatra pravāhayet nādam nāḍīviṣuvat ucyate
translated: There, one should make the sound flow. It is said to be the equinox of the channels.

analyzed: praśāntam viṣuvat ca evam adhunā kathayāmi te
translated: Now I shall tell you about the tranquil and the equinoctial.

analyzed: ayane ṣaṣ aṅgulaḥ cāraḥ kāraṇāni aṅgule ṅgule
translated: The movement is six finger-breadths in the solstices, and the causes are one finger-breadth apart.

analyzed: tāni adhastāt parityajya kāraṇāni ṣaḍ eva tu
translated: Having abandoned those causes below, there are only six causes.

analyzed: saptame tu praśāntam vai praśānta indriya gocaram
translated: But in the seventh, it is tranquil, the sphere of the tranquil senses.

original: praśāntaḥ stimito jñeyaḥ stimito niścalaḥ smṛtaḥ // / //
analyzed: praśāntaḥ stimitaḥ jñeyaḥ stimitaḥ niścalaḥ smṛtaḥ
translated: The tranquil should be known as still, and the still is remembered as motionless.

analyzed: niścalaḥ nistaraṅgaḥ ca sthiraḥ pūrṇaḥ samantataḥ
translated: The motionless is wave-free, firm, and full all around.

original: evaṃbhāvaṃ samāsthāya dīkṣā kāryā tu daiśikaiḥ // / //
analyzed: evaṃbhāvam samāsthāya dīkṣā kāryā tu daiśikaiḥ
translated: Having attained this state, the initiation should be performed by the teachers.

analyzed: etat praśānta viṣuvat śakti upādhim nibodha me
translated: This is the tranquil equinoctial. Understand from me the limiting adjunct of Śakti.

analyzed: śakti madhya gataḥ nādaḥ nāda ūrdhvam ca caret yadā
translated: When the sound resides in the middle of Śakti and moves above the sound,

original: tāvattu śaktiviṣuvat kālākhyaṃ tu nibodha me /
analyzed: tāvat tu śakti viṣuvat kāla ākhyam tu nibodha me
translated: then that is the Śakti equinoctial. Understand from me the one called time.

original: tuṭiḥ ṣoḍaśakā yā tu prāṇānte saṃvyavasthitā // / //
analyzed: tuṭiḥ ṣoḍaśakā yā tu prāṇānte saṃvyavasthitā
translated: The sixteenth tuți that is established at the end of the vital breath,

analyzed: kālaḥ bhrū kṣepa mātraḥ tu tatra ante kīrtitaḥ mayā
translated: time is merely the time of a brow-beat, which I have declared at the end of that.

analyzed: tam para apara bhāgena punar eva tridhā kuru
translated: Make that again threefold by the parts of the supreme and the inferior.

original: aparaḥ ṣoḍaśo yāvat kālaḥ saptadaśaḥ paraḥ /
analyzed: aparaḥ ṣoḍaśaḥ yāvat kālaḥ saptadaśaḥ paraḥ
translated: The inferior is up to the sixteenth, the supreme is the seventeenth.

original: parāparastu yaḥ kālaḥ sa priye 'ṣṭādaśaḥ prabhuḥ // / //
analyzed: parāparaḥ tu yaḥ kālaḥ sa priye ṣṭādaśaḥ prabhuḥ
translated: O Beloved, the supreme and inferior time is the eighteenth lord.

original: prāṇa evaṃ tridhā kālaṃ kṛtvā caiva tyajetpunaḥ /
analyzed: prāṇaḥ evam tridhā kālam kṛtvā ca eva tyajet punar
translated: Having divided time into three parts in this way, one should again abandon it.

analyzed: aparaḥ śakti mūrdha sthaḥ vyāpinyām ca dvitīyakaḥ
translated: The other is at the head of Śakti, the second is in Vyāpinī,

analyzed: tṛtīyaḥ samanā sthāne tat kāla viṣuvat smṛtam
translated: The third is in the location of the Equal One, that is known as the equinox of that time.

analyzed: etat ṣaṣṭham samākhyātam saptamam tātvvam ucyate
translated: This is said to be the sixth, the seventh is said to be the tattva (principle).

analyzed: unmanā paratas devi tatra ātmānam niyojayet
translated: O Goddess, the Transmental is beyond that, one should engage the Self there.

analyzed: tasmin yuktaḥ tatas hi ātmā tanmayaḥ ca prajāyate
translated: When the Self is engaged in that, it becomes identified with it.

analyzed: tattva ākhyam viṣuvat devi sarveṣām paratas sthitam
translated: The equinox named Tattva, O Goddess, is situated beyond all.

original: viṣuvadevaṃvidhaṃ jñātvā ko na mucyeta bandhanāt // / //🔽viṣuvatte samākhyātaṃ padārthabhedanaṃ śṛṇu /
analyzed: viṣuvat evaṃvidham jñātvā kaḥ na mucyeta bandhanāt  viṣuvat te samākhyātam padārtha bhedanam śṛṇu
translated: Knowing the equinox to be of this kind, who would not be liberated from bondage?🔽The equinox has been explained to you. Listen to the division of the meanings of words.

original: tyāgaṃ cānubhavaṃ caiva yojanaṃ ca pare pade // / //🔽padārthaikādaśī jñeyā unmanāntaḥ paro bhavet /🔽bhedayejjñānaśūlena jñānaṃ jñeyasya jñāpakam // / //
analyzed: tyāgam ca anubhavam ca eva yojanam ca pare pade             bhedayet jñāna śūlena jñānam jñeyasya jñāpakam
translated: Abandonment, experience, and union in the supreme state,🔽The eleventh meaning of the word should be known to be beyond the Transmental.🔽One should pierce with the spear of knowledge, the knowledge that indicates the knowable.

analyzed: jñāpakam bodham atulam dīpavat yotanam yatas
translated: The incomparable knowledge that indicates is like a lamp, because it illuminates.

analyzed: dīpa hastaḥ yathā kaścid dravyam ālokya ca āharet
translated: Just as someone with a lamp in hand would see and take a substance,

original: evaṃ jñānena ca jñeyaṃ tasmin kuryāttu saṃsthitam /
analyzed: evam jñānena ca jñeyam tasmin kuryāt tu saṃsthitam
translated: In the same way, the knowable should be established in that by knowledge.

original: jñānaṃ vai lakṣaṇaṃ proktaṃ jñeyatatvasya suvrate // / //
analyzed: jñānam vai lakṣaṇam proktam jñeya tatvasya suvrate
translated: Knowledge is said to be the characteristic of the knowable reality, O one of good vows.

original: lakṣaṇaṃ guṇa ākhyātaḥ kalā tattvasya sarvadā /
analyzed: lakṣaṇam guṇaḥ ākhyātaḥ kalā tattvasya sarvadā
translated: The characteristic is said to be the quality, and the part is always of the reality.

original: na guṇena vinā tattvaṃ na tattvena vinā guṇaḥ // / //
analyzed: na guṇena vinā tattvam na tattvena vinā guṇaḥ
translated: The reality is not without the quality, and the quality is not without the reality.

original: guṇaṃ gṛhṇanti sarvatra na tattvaṃ gṛhyate kvacit /🔽gṛhyate hyanumānena pratyak /ānubhavena ca // / //
analyzed: guṇam gṛhṇanti sarvatra na tattvam gṛhyate kvacid  gṛhyate hi anumānena pratyakā anubhavena ca
translated: The quality is grasped everywhere, but the reality is not grasped anywhere.🔽It is grasped by inference and by the experience of the inner self.

analyzed: arthi pratyarthi bhāvena āgamena tu labhyate
translated: It is obtained by the state of being a petitioner and a respondent, and by scripture.

analyzed: āgamaḥ anantāḥ śāstra koṭayaḥ
translated: Scripture is knowledge endowed with this, and there are countless millions of scriptures.

original: śāstraṃ śabdātmakaṃ sarvaṃ śabdo haṃsaḥ prakīrtitaḥ /
analyzed: śāstram śabda ātmakam sarvam śabdaḥ haṃsaḥ prakīrtitaḥ
translated: All scripture is of the nature of sound, and sound is declared to be the swan.

analyzed: haṃsa yogaḥ purā ākhyātaḥ mātrā saṃkhyā tu atha ucyate
translated: The yoga of the swan was explained before, now the enumeration of mātrās is being stated.

analyzed: mātrā yogaḥ yathā ca asya pramāṇam hṛdaya ādisu
translated: As for the yoga of mātrās, the measure is from the heart and so on.

analyzed: nābheḥ ūrdhvam vitasti ante kaṇṭha adhastāt ṣaṣ aṅgule
translated: Above the navel, up to the distance of a vitasti, and six aṅgulas below the throat.

analyzed: hṛdayam madhya deśe tu catur aṅgula saṃmitam
translated: The heart is in the middle region, measuring four aṅgulas.

analyzed: caturviṃśati tattvaiḥ tu brahmā tatra vyavasthitaḥ
translated: Brahma is established there with the twenty-four principles.

analyzed: kaṇṭham aṣṭa aṅgulam viddhi viṣṇuḥ tatra vyavasthitaḥ
translated: Know the throat to be eight finger-breadths, Vishnu is established there.

analyzed: tattva aṣṭakena saṃyuktaḥ tad ūrdhvam catur aṅgulam
translated: United with the eight principles, above that, four finger-breadths...

analyzed: māyā tattvam samāśritya rudraḥ tālu tale sthitaḥ
translated: Rudra is established on the palate, depending on the principle of Maya.

analyzed: aṅgula dvaya mānam tu bhruvoḥ madhyam prakīrtitam
translated: The space between the eyebrows is declared to be two finger-breadths in measure...

analyzed: tatra īśvaraḥ sthitaḥ devi tattva dvaya samanvitaḥ
translated: There, O Goddess, Isvara is situated, endowed with two principles.

analyzed: ekādaśa aṅgule ca eva mūrdhvam devaḥ sadāśivaḥ
translated: And in eleven finger-breadths, above, is the god Sadasiva...

analyzed: tattva dvaya samāyuktaḥ yāvat brahmabilam gataḥ
translated: Endowed with two principles, he has gone up to the cavity of Brahma.

analyzed: tad ūrdhva eka aṅgulā śaktiḥ śivaḥ tatra vyavasthitaḥ
translated: Above that, one finger-breadth, is Shakti, and Shiva is established there...

original: tvakcheṣe vyāpinī proktā samanā conmanā tataḥ /
analyzed: tvak śeṣe vyāpinī proktā samanā ca unmanā tatas
translated: In the remaining skin, Vyapini is declared, then Samana and Unmana.

analyzed: tat param tu param tattvam pramāṇa parivarjitam
translated: Beyond that is the supreme principle, devoid of all means of knowledge...

original: mātrāsaṃkhyā ca yogaścā dhunā haṃsasya kathyate /
analyzed: mātrā saṃkhyā ca dhunā haṃsasya kathyate
translated: The measure of Matra and Yoga are now being told of the Hamsa.

analyzed: akāraḥ ca hakāraḥ ca dvau etau ekatas sthitau
translated: The letter A and the letter Ha, these two are situated as one...

analyzed: vibhaktiḥ na anayoḥ asti māruta ambarayoḥ iva
translated: There is no difference between them, like that between air and space.

analyzed: eka mātraḥ sa vijñeyaḥ hṛdayāt saṃpravartate
translated: That should be known as one mātrā, and it arises from the heart.

analyzed: ukāraḥ tu dvi mātraḥ vai kaṇṭha sthāne samuccaret
translated: The letter u is two mātrās long, and it should be pronounced in the throat.

analyzed: tri mātraḥ tu makāraḥ vai tālu madhya gataḥ caret
translated: The letter m is three mātrās long, and it should be pronounced in the middle of the palate.

analyzed: binduḥ ca eva ardha mātraḥ tu mātrārdham hi saḥ ucyate
translated: The bindu is half a mātrā, and it is said to be half a mātrā.

original: bhruvormadhye sa uccāras tasya devi vidhīyate // / //
analyzed: bhruvoḥ madhye saḥ uccāraḥ tasya devi vidhīyate
translated: Its pronunciation is prescribed in the middle of the eyebrows, O Goddess.

analyzed: tad śeṣāt ca ardhacandraḥ tu pāda mātraḥ tu asau bhavet
translated: And the crescent moon is the remainder of that, and it should be one-fourth.

analyzed: nirodhī ca ardha pādaḥ tu lalāṭa ante samuccaret
translated: The nirodhini should be pronounced at the end of the forehead, which is half a mātrā.

analyzed: nādaḥ ṣoḍaśaka aṃśaḥ tu mūrdha antam yāvat uccaret
translated: The nāda is one-sixteenth part, and it should be pronounced up to the end of the head.

analyzed: dvātriṃśat aṃśā śaktiḥ tu ṣaṭtriṃśa ante samuccaret
translated: The śakti is thirty-two parts, and it should be pronounced up to the end of thirty-six.

analyzed: vyāpinī catuḥṣaṣṭi aṃśā śakteḥ tu paratas sthitā
translated: The vyāpinī is sixty-four parts, and it is situated beyond the śakti.

analyzed: samanā ca unmanā ca ūrdhvam amātraḥ paramaḥ vyayaḥ
translated: The samanā and unmanā are above, and the supreme imperishable one is beyond mātrās.

analyzed: mātrā saṃkhyā ca yogaḥ ca pramāṇam parikīrtitam
translated: The number of mātrās and yoga are declared to be the measure.

analyzed: evam jñātvā varārohe padārthān bhedayet tatas
translated: Knowing this, O beautiful lady, one should then divide the meanings.

analyzed: bhedayet matra śūlena mudrā bhāva yutena ca
translated: One should divide with the mantra dart, endowed with mudrā and bhāva.

original: mantro vai jñānaśaktiśca mudrā caiva kriyātmikā // / //
analyzed: mantraḥ vai jñāna śaktiḥ ca mudrā ca eva kriyā ātmikā
translated: Mantra is indeed the power of knowledge, and mudra is of the nature of action.

analyzed: bhāvaḥ ca manaḥ iti uktam tat manaḥ buddhi pūrvakam
translated: And the mind is said to be the thought, that mind is preceded by the intellect.

analyzed: paraḥ ca manasā gamyaḥ icchā śaktyā tu adhiṣṭhitaḥ
translated: And the supreme one is to be known by the mind, controlled by the power of desire.

original: yatra yatra bhavedicchā jñānaṃ tatra pravartate /
analyzed: yatra yatra bhavet icchā jñānam tatra pravartate
translated: Wherever there is desire, knowledge functions there.

analyzed: kriyā karaṇa saṃbandhāt tattvasya uccāraṇam bhavet
translated: The utterance of the reality is due to the connection of action and instrument.

original: kriyākaraṇahīnasya na caivoccāraṇaṃ bhavet /🔽kriyā karaṇabhedena sā caiva trividhā smṛtā // / //
analyzed: kriyā karaṇa hīnasya na ca eva uccāraṇam bhavet  kriyā karaṇa bhedena sā ca eva trividhā smṛtā
translated: And the utterance would not be without action and instrument.🔽And that is remembered to be of three kinds due to the difference of action and instrument.

analyzed: ekena uccārayet tattvam karaṇena vicakṣaṇaḥ
translated: The wise one should utter that reality with one instrument.

analyzed: nāḍīḥ ca atha dvitīyena dvārāṇi ca nirodhayet
translated: And with the second, one should block the channels and doors.

original: tṛtīyaṃ karaṇaṃ divyaṃ kṛtvā vai tattvamuccaret /
analyzed: tṛtīyam karaṇam divyam kṛtvā vai tattvam uccaret
translated: Having made the third divine instrument, one should utter the reality.

analyzed: pūrakam kumbhakam kṛtvā sarva dvārāṇi rodhayet
translated: Having performed the filling and the holding of breath, one should block all the doors.

analyzed: guda dvāreṇa ruddhena ruddhāni atra bhavanti hi
translated: When the door of the anus is blocked, the others become blocked.

analyzed: dvāram ekam tatas ca ūrdhve pravahat tat vicintayet
translated: Then one should contemplate that one door above flowing.

analyzed: nāḍayaḥ granthi padmāḥ ca ye dhomukha gatāḥ priye
translated: O beloved, the channels, the knots, and the lotuses that are below, facing downwards,

analyzed: te kumbhakena saṃruddhāḥ vikasanti samantataḥ
translated: When they are restrained by Kumbhaka, they expand in all directions.

original: karaṇaṃ tu tataḥ kṛtvā lakṣaṇaṃ tasya vai śṛṇu /🔽jihvā tu tāluke yojyā kiṃcidūrdhvaṃ na saṃspṛśet // / //
analyzed: karaṇam tu tatas kṛtvā lakṣaṇam tasya vai śṛṇu  jihvā tu tāluke yojyā kiṃcid ūrdhvam na saṃspṛśet
translated: Having done the Karana, listen to its characteristic.🔽The tongue should be joined to the palate, not quite touching it.

original: īṣatprasārya vaktraṃ tu kiṃcidoṣṭhau na saṃspṛśet /
analyzed: īṣat prasārya vaktram tu kiṃcid oṣṭhau na saṃspṛśet
translated: Having slightly opened the mouth, the lips should not quite touch each other.

original: dantapaṅktī tathaiveha dṛṣṭiścādhordhvavarjitā // / //🔽kāyaṃ samunnataṃ kṛtvā karaṇaṃ divyamucyate /
analyzed: danta paṅktī tathā evā iha dṛṣṭiḥ ca adhas ūrdhva varjitā  kāyam samunnatam kṛtvā karaṇam divyam ucyate
translated: The rows of teeth should be the same here, and the gaze should be free from looking up or down.🔽Having straightened the body, the divine Karana is said to be done.

original: divyaṃ ca karaṇaṃ kṛtvā tattvasyoccāraṇaṃ kuru // / //🔽kumbhitaścaiva yaḥ prāṇo recayettaṃ śanaiḥ śanaiḥ /
analyzed: divyam ca karaṇam kṛtvā tattvasya uccāraṇam kuru  kumbhitaḥ ca eva yaḥ prāṇaḥ recayet tam śanais śanais
translated: Having done the divine Karana, utter the Tattva.🔽The Prana that is held in Kumbhaka should be slowly exhaled.

analyzed: nāḍayaḥ granthi padmāḥ ca dehe yāḥ saṃvyavasthitāḥ
translated: The Nadis and Granthi lotuses that are situated in the body

analyzed: recakena samākṣiptāḥ ūrdhvasrotaḥ bhavanti te
translated: are drawn upwards by Recaka and become the upward current.

original: tato vai jñānaśūlena granthīnbhindan samuccaret // / //🔽bhitvā hṛtpadmagranthiṃ tu tataḥ śabdaḥ prajāyate /
analyzed: tatas vai jñāna śūlena granthīn bhindan samuccaret  bhitvā hṛd padma granthim tu tatas śabdaḥ prajāyate
translated: Then, piercing the Granthis with the spear of knowledge, one should utter.🔽Having pierced the Granthi of the lotus of the heart, then sound arises.🔽When it becomes like the sound of a bell due to the union with space,

analyzed: yat ākāśa samāyogāt ghoṣa śabda upamaḥ bhavet
translated: then the sound of the supreme Self is heard.

analyzed: kaṇṭha sthaḥ viramet śabdaḥ kaṇṭham prāpya varānane
translated: O beautiful-faced one, when the sound reaches the throat, it ceases.

analyzed: bhindataḥ kaṇṭha deśam tu śabdaḥ dhugadhugāyate
translated: When it breaks through the throat region, the sound becomes dhug-dhug.

analyzed: tālu madhya gataḥ prāṇaḥ yadā bhavati suvrate
translated: O one of good vows, when the vital breath resides in the middle of the palate,

analyzed: bindataḥ tālu granthim tu śabdaḥ ghumaghumāyate
translated: and when it breaks through the knot of the palate, the sound becomes ghura-ghura.

original: evaṃ te 'nubhavāḥ proktāḥ prāṇe carati suvrate /
analyzed: evam te nubhavāḥ proktāḥ prāṇe carati suvrate
translated: Thus, O one of good vows, the experiences have been described as the vital breath moves.

analyzed: trayaḥ te ṣṭa kalāḥ proktāḥ upari uparitas kramāt
translated: Those three are said to be the eight parts, one above the other in order.

original: tiṣṭhetsa yatra vai prāṇa ātmā tadgatimāpnuyāt /
analyzed: tiṣṭhet sa yatra vai prāṇaḥ ātmā tat gatim āpnuyāt
translated: Wherever the vital breath resides, the soul attains its state.

analyzed: tat tat rūpam bhavet tasya sthāna bhāva anurūpataḥ
translated: It becomes of that form, in accordance with the nature of that state.

analyzed: bhruvoḥ madhyam yadā gacchet sphoṭa śabdaḥ tu jāyate
translated: When it goes to the middle of the eyebrows, the sound of bursting occurs.

analyzed: bindum bhedayataḥ devi śabdaḥ dhumadhumāyate
translated: O Goddess, when the drop is pierced, the sound becomes dhūma-dhūma.

analyzed: kapiḥ vai nārikīlena ācāryaḥ saha bindunā
translated: The teacher, along with the drop, is like a monkey with a coconut.

original: abhinnena kuto mokṣaṃ sabāhyābhyantaraṃ priye // / //🔽bhitvā binduṃ tato devi ardhacandraṃ vibhedayet /
analyzed: abhinnena kutas mokṣam sa bāhya abhyantaram priye  bhitvā bindum tatas devi ardhacandram vibhedayet
translated: O Beloved, how can there be liberation without the undivided one, both externally and internally?🔽Then, O Goddess, having pierced the drop, one should pierce the half-moon.

analyzed: bhidyataḥ ca ardhacandrasya lalāṭe jhimijhimāyate
translated: When the half-moon is pierced, there is jhim-jhim sound on the forehead.

original: ardhacandraṃ tu bhittvā vai bhedayettu nirodhinīm /
analyzed: ardhacandram tu bhittvā vai bhedayet tu nirodhinīm
translated: Having pierced the half-moon, one should pierce the Nirodhinī.

analyzed: tasyāḥ tu bhidyamānāyāḥ śabdaḥ simisimāyate
translated: When it is being pierced, the sound is like 'simisimāyana'.

analyzed: sthana trayam idam devi pañca pañca kalā anvitam
translated: O Goddess, this triad of places is endowed with five and five digits.

analyzed: prāṇasya carataḥ tatra yasmin sthāne sa tiṣṭhati
translated: When the life force moves there, in which place it resides,

analyzed: tad tad rūpaḥ bhavet ātmā tām tām gatim avāpnuyāt
translated: the Self becomes of that form and attains that state.

analyzed: nirodhinīm bhedayitvā tatas nādam vrajet budhaḥ
translated: Having pierced the Nirodhinī, the wise one should then proceed to the Nāda.

analyzed: vaṃśa śabda samaḥ śabdaḥ tatra sūkṣmaḥ prajāyate
translated: A sound similar to the sound of a flute arises there, subtle.

analyzed: bhedayet nāda saṃsthānam brahmarandhram su durbhidam
translated: One should pierce the Nāda-sthāna, the very difficult to pierce Brahmadvāra.

analyzed: bhidyataḥ brahmarandhrasya śabdaḥ śumaśumāyate
translated: When the Brahmadvāra is being pierced, the sound is like 'śumaśumāyana'.

analyzed: śakti madhya gataḥ prāṇaḥ vaṃśa nāda anta saṃnibhaḥ
translated: The life force located in the middle of the Śakti, like the end of the sound of a flute,

original: tāṃ vai tu bhedayecchaktiṃ durbhedyāṃ sarvayoginām /
analyzed: tām vai tu bhedayet śaktim durbhedyām sarva yoginām
translated: one should pierce that Śakti, which is difficult to pierce for all yogis.

original: bhidyate ca yadā śaktiḥ śāntaḥ śumaśumastataḥ // / //
analyzed: bhidyate ca yadā śaktiḥ śāntaḥ śumaśumaḥ tatas
translated: When the Śakti is pierced, then there is the peaceful 'śumaśuma'.

original: śaktiṃ bhitvā tato devi yaccheṣaṃ vyāpinī bhavet /
analyzed: śaktim bhitvā tatas devi yat śeṣam vyāpinī bhavet
translated: Having pierced the Śakti, O Goddess, what remains is the all-pervading.

analyzed: anubhāvaḥ bavet tatra sparśaḥ yadvat pipīlikā
translated: There arises the experience, like the touch of an ant.

analyzed: sthāna trayam idam devi pañca pañca kalā anvitam
translated: O Goddess, this triad of places is endowed with five times five digits.

analyzed: yatra yatra caret prāṇaḥ tad tad rūpam avāpnuyāt
translated: Wherever the vital energy moves, one attains that form.

analyzed: yatra yatra avatiṣṭheta tām tām gatim avāpnuyāt
translated: Wherever it abides, one attains that state.

original: tasmādvai suprayatnena bhitvā yāti parāṃ gatim // / //🔽bhitvā vai vyāpinīṃ devi samanāyāṃ manastyajet /
analyzed: tasmāt vai su prayatnena bhitvā yāti parām gatim  bhitvā vai vyāpinīm devi samanāyām manaḥ tyajet
translated: Therefore, having pierced through with great effort, one attains the supreme state.🔽Having pierced through the all-pervading one, O Goddess, one should abandon the mind in the samana.

original: manasā tu manastyaktvā jīvaḥ kevalatāṃ vrajet // / //
analyzed: manasā tu manaḥ tyaktvā jīvaḥ kevala tām vrajet
translated: Having abandoned the mind with the mind, the individual soul attains pure existence.

analyzed: jīvaḥ vai kevalaḥ tatra ātma jñāna kriyā anvitaḥ
translated: The individual soul there, endowed with the knowledge and action of the Self,

analyzed: bandhana aśeṣa nirmuktaḥ sattā mātra svarūpakaḥ
translated: is completely liberated from all bondage, having the nature of mere existence.
Transcending all the stages of the path, consisting of pure knowledge alone,

original: gṛhāṇāti nāparaṃ bhāvaṃ na paraṃ ca śivātmakam // / //🔽parāparavinirmuktaḥ svātmanyātmā vyavasthitaḥ /
analyzed: gṛhāṇāti na aparam bhāvam na param ca śiva ātmakam  para apara vinirmuktaḥ sva ātmani ātmā vyavasthitaḥ
translated: does not grasp any other state, neither the lower nor the higher, which is of the nature of Śiva.🔽Liberated from the higher and lower, the Self abides in one's own nature.

analyzed: ātma vyāptiḥ bhavet eṣā śiva vyāptiḥ atas param
translated: This is the pervasion of the Self, beyond which is the pervasion of Śiva.

analyzed: bandhana aśeṣa bhāvena sarva adhva upādhi varjitā
translated: Free from all the limiting adjuncts of the entire path,

original: aviditvā paraṃ tattvaṃ śivatvaṃ kalpitaṃ tu yaiḥ // / //
analyzed: a viditvā param tattvam śiva tvam kalpitam tu yaiḥ
translated: those who have not known the supreme reality, for whom Śiva-hood is imagined,

original: ta ātmopāsakāḥ śaive na gacchanti paraṃ śivam /
analyzed: te ātma upāsakāḥ śaive na gacchanti param śivam
translated: Those who worship the Self in Śiva do not attain the Supreme Śiva.

analyzed: ātma tattva gatim yānti ātma tattva anurañjitāḥ  tasmāt ātmā parityājyaḥ yadi icchet śivam ātmanaḥ
translated: They become engrossed in the truth of the Self and attain the state of the truth of the Self.🔽Therefore, if one desires Śiva for oneself, the Self should be abandoned.

analyzed: ātma tattvam tatas tyājyam vidyā tatve niyojayet
translated: Then, the truth of the Self should be abandoned and one should be engaged in the truth of knowledge.

original: unmanā sā tu vijñeyā manaḥ saṃkalpa ucyate /
analyzed: unmanā sā tu vijñeyā manaḥ saṃkalpaḥ ucyate
translated: That should be known as the Transmental, and the mind is said to be volition.

analyzed: saṃkalpaḥ kramatas jñānam unmānam yugapad sthitam
translated: Volition is knowledge in sequence, and the Transmental is present simultaneously.

original: tasmāt sā tu parā vidyā yasmādanyā na vidyate /
analyzed: tasmāt sā tu parā vidyā yasmāt anyā na vidyate
translated: Therefore, that is the Supreme Knowledge, since there is no other.

analyzed: vindate hi atra yugapad sārvajñya ādi guṇān parān
translated: For here, one simultaneously attains the supreme qualities such as omniscience.

analyzed: vedanā nādi dharmasya parama ātma tva bodhanā
translated: The teaching of the beginningless nature of experience is the realization of the Supreme Self.

original: varjanā paramātmatve tasmādvidyeti socyate // / //🔽tatrastho vyañjayettejaḥ paraṃ paramakāraṇam /
analyzed: varjanā parama ātma tve tasmāt vidyā iti sā ucyate  tatrasthaḥ vyañjayet tejaḥ param parama kāraṇam
translated: The abandonment in the Supreme Self is therefore called knowledge.🔽Dwelling there, one should manifest the supreme splendor, the highest cause.

analyzed: parasmin tejasi vyakte tatrasthaḥ śiva tām vrajet
translated: When the supreme splendor is manifested, dwelling there, one attains Śivahood.

original: supradīpte yathā vahnau śikhā dṛśyeta cāmbare /
analyzed: su pradīpte yathā vahnau śikhā dṛśyeta ca ambare
translated: Just as a flame is seen in the sky in a well-kindled fire,

analyzed: deha prāṇa sthitaḥ hi ātmā tadvat līyeta tad pade
translated: so the Self abiding in the body and life-force would be seen in that state.

analyzed: tadvat eva abhimānaḥ tu kartavyaḥ daiśika uttamaiḥ
translated: In the same way, the best of teachers should have such pride,

analyzed: aham eva paraḥ haṃsaḥ śivaḥ parama kāraṇam
translated: I am the supreme swan, Śiva, the supreme cause.

original: matprāṇe sa tu paśvātmā līnaḥ samarasīgataḥ /
analyzed: mad prāṇe sa tu paśu ātmā līnaḥ samarasī gataḥ
translated: In my vital breath, that individual soul is merged, having become of the same essence.

original: mantrakaraṇakriyāyogād yojayāmi pare śive // / //🔽evaṃ yo vetti tattvena agnivaddehamadhyataḥ /
analyzed: mantra karaṇa kriyā yogāt yojayāmi pare śive  evam yaḥ vetti tattvena agni vat deha madhyatas
translated: By the yoga of the action of the mantra-instruments, I unite it with the supreme Śiva.🔽One who knows this truth, as if in the middle of the body like fire,

analyzed: yadvat vahni śikhā atītā tadvat yojayate pare
translated: Just as it is united with the supreme beyond the flame of fire.

analyzed: tasmin yuktaḥ pare tattve sārvajñya ādi guṇa anvitaḥ
translated: When it is thus engaged in the supreme reality, endowed with the qualities of omniscience and so on,

original: śiva eko bhaveddevi avibhāgena sarvataḥ // / //🔽tattvatrayaṃ paraṃ khyātam aparaṃ cādhvamadhyagam /
analyzed: śivaḥ ekaḥ bhavet devi avibhāgena sarvatas  tattva trayam param khyātam aparam ca adhva madhya gam
translated: O Goddess, Śiva becomes one, undivided, everywhere.🔽The triad of principles is known as supreme, and the other is in the middle of the path.

analyzed: bhedanam tu padārthānām tyāga anubhava yojanam
translated: The division of entities, the abandonment, experience, and union.

original: pūrvoktaṃ ca idaṃ sarvaṃ jñātvā tattve niyojayet /
analyzed: pūrva uktam ca idam sarvam jñātvā tattve niyojayet
translated: Having known all this mentioned before, one should engage it in the principle.

original: saṃkṣepeṇa tu tattvasya vyāptiṃ śṛṇu sureśvari // / //
analyzed: saṃkṣepeṇa tu tattvasya vyāptim śṛṇu sureśvari
translated: But listen to the pervasion of the principle in brief, O Queen of Gods.

analyzed: vidyā tattva āspadam baddhvā bindu tattva āsane sthitaḥ
translated: Having bound the abode of the principle of knowledge, seated on the seat of the principle of the drop,

analyzed: nāda śakti tanuḥ ca eva vyāpinī karaṇa anvitaḥ
translated: Having the body of the sound and power, pervaded by the all-pervading, endowed with the instruments,

analyzed: sarvajña tva avabodhena samanā antaścarā tu sā
translated: And that is the movement within the supreme state of being, which is the attainment of omniscience.

original: tritatvaṃ yatparaṃ proktaṃ tena cāpūritā tanuḥ // / //
analyzed: trita tvam yat param proktam tena ca āpūritā tanuḥ
translated: And that is the supreme reality, which is said to be beyond the three principles, and by which the body is not filled.

original: aparā sā tanuḥ sthūlā ṣaṭviṃśattattvakalpitā /🔽tattvatrayaṃ paraṃ yacca sarvatattvādhvavarjitam // / //
analyzed: aparā sā tanuḥ sthūlā ṣaṭviṃśat tattva kalpitā  tattva trayam param yat ca sarva tattva adhva varjitam
translated: That is the lower, gross body, conceived of as the twenty-six principles.🔽And that which is the supreme triad of principles, devoid of the path of all principles,

analyzed: tena ca āpūrita aśeṣam sā tattva adhva parā tanuḥ
translated: by which the entire path of principles is filled, that is the supreme body.

analyzed: evam ācarate yaḥ tu ācāram tu śiva ātmakam
translated: Thus, he who practices the conduct that is of the nature of Śiva,

analyzed: śivena sahacāri tvāt ācāryaḥ tena ca ucyate
translated: is called an ācārya because of his conduct with Śiva.

analyzed: tasya darśana saṃbhāṣā sparśanāt smaraṇāt api
translated: By seeing, conversing with, touching, or even remembering him,

analyzed: bhavati eva aiśvarī vyāptiḥ na bhavet tad adhas gatiḥ
translated: the all-pervasiveness of Śiva occurs, and there is no falling below that.

original: tena saṃyojito jantuḥ brahmahāpi śivo bhavet // / //
analyzed: tena saṃyojitaḥ jantuḥ brahma hā api śivaḥ bhavet
translated: The creature united with him becomes Śiva, even if he has killed a brahmin.

analyzed: tatas tena samaḥ nā asti jagati asmin carācare
translated: Therefore, there is no one equal to him in this world of moving and unmoving beings.
Śiva, the benefactor of the worlds, takes the form of an ācārya.

original: tasmānna mānavīṃ buddhiṃ kārayeddeśakaṃ prati /🔽ācāryasya ca mantrasya śivajñāne śivasya ca // / //
analyzed: tasmāt na mānavīm buddhim kārayet deśakam prati  ācāryasya ca mantrasya śiva jñāne śivasya ca
translated: Therefore, one should not entertain human thoughts towards the ācārya.

analyzed: nānātvam nā eva kurvanti vidyeśāḥ cakra nāyakāḥ
translated: The vidyeśvaras and cakranāyakas do not make any difference between the ācārya, the mantra, the knowledge of Śiva, and Śiva himself.

original: brāhmaṇāḥ kṣatriyā vaiśyāḥ śūdrā vai vīravandite // / //
analyzed: brāhmaṇāḥ kṣatriyāḥ vaiśyāḥ śūdrāḥ vai vīra vandite
translated: Brahmins, Kshatriyas, Vaishyas, and Shudras, O you who are worshipped by the heroes,

original: ācāryatve niyuktā ye te sarve tu śivāḥ smṛtāḥ /
analyzed: ācārya tve niyuktāḥ ye te sarve tu śivāḥ smṛtāḥ
translated: Those who are appointed as teachers are all considered to be Shiva.

analyzed: anyathā prāc sva rūpeṇa ye paśyanti nara adhamāḥ
translated: Those lowest of men who see otherwise, in their original form,

analyzed: narake te prapacyante sādākhyam vatsara trayam
translated: They are cooked in hell for three years called Sadakhya.

original: na tena saha saṃbhāṣā kartavyā tu śivārthinā // / //
analyzed: na tena saha saṃbhāṣā kartavyā tu śiva arthinā
translated: One who desires Shiva should not engage in conversation with him.

original: kṛtvā saṃbhāṣaṇaṃ tena narakaṃ so 'pi gacchati /
analyzed: kṛtvā saṃbhāṣaṇam tena narakam saḥ pi gacchati
translated: By engaging in conversation with him, he too goes to hell.

analyzed: tasmāt śiva samāḥ sarve draṣṭavyāḥ muktim icchatā
translated: Therefore, all those who are equal to Shiva should be seen by one who desires liberation.

analyzed: bhukti mukti phala avāptiḥ bhavati eva tad ājñayā
translated: The attainment of the fruits of enjoyment and liberation certainly occurs by his command.

analyzed: ācāryaḥ ca kula koṭi sahasraśas
translated: The teacher, of those who know his own (true) nature, of thousands of crores of families,

analyzed: jñāna jñeya parijñānāt samastāḥ tārayiṣyati
translated: By knowing knowledge and the knowable, will liberate all.

analyzed: evam ukta vidhāna jñaḥ bhāva jñaḥ ca api daiśikaḥ
translated: The teacher who knows the rules stated thus, and also knows the reality,

analyzed: pūrṇāhutyā ekayā eva asau paśūn yojayate pare
translated: By just one full oblation, he conquers the souls of the sacrificial animals in the supreme.

analyzed: pūrṇāhuti prayogam tu kathayāmi adhunā tava
translated: Now I shall tell you the application of the full oblation.

analyzed: ūrdhva kāyaḥ ṛju grīvaḥ sama pādaḥ vyavasthitaḥ
translated: With the upper body erect, the neck straight, and the feet evenly placed,

original: nābhisthāne sruco mūlam uttānāgramukhaṃ samam // / //🔽srucyupari sruvaṃ devi kṛtvā caivamadhomukham /
analyzed: nābhi sthāne srucaḥ mūlam uttāna agra mukham samam  sruci upari sruvam devi kṛtvā ca evam adhomukham
translated: The root of the ladle should be at the navel, with the tip facing upwards and straight.🔽O Goddess, having placed the sacrificial ladle on the ladle, with the mouth facing downwards,

original: puṣpaṃ dattvā srugagre tu darbheṇa sahitau karau // / //
analyzed: puṣpam dattvā sruc agre tu darbheṇa sahitau karau
translated: having offered a flower at the tip of the ladle, with the hands along with the darbha grass,

original: muṣṭinā caiva hastābhyāṃ gṛhītvā yatnato 'pi ca /
analyzed: muṣṭinā ca eva hastābhyām gṛhītvā ca
translated: having grasped with the fists and with both hands, and having made an effort,

original: agrato dakṣiṇaṃ hastaṃ vāmaṃ vai pṛṣṭataḥ priye // / //
analyzed: agratas dakṣiṇam hastam vāmam vai pṛṣṭatas priye
translated: the right hand in front, and the left one at the back, O beloved,

analyzed: muṣṭibhyām saṃgṛhītvā vai uttāna kara yogataḥ
translated: having grasped with the fists, with the hands outstretched,

original: tato ghṛtena saṃplāvya abhimānaṃ tu kārayet // / //
analyzed: tatas ghṛtena saṃplāvya abhimānam tu kārayet
translated: then having sprinkled with ghee, one should perform the conceit,

analyzed: aham eva param tattvam para apara vibhāgataḥ
translated: I alone am the supreme reality, by the division of the supreme and the inferior.

original: tattvamekaṃ hi sarvatra nānyaṃ bhāvaṃ tu kārayet // / //
analyzed: tattvam ekam hi sarvatra na anyam bhāvam tu kārayet
translated: The reality is indeed one everywhere, one should not make any other conception.

analyzed: yat kumbhe vinyastaḥ ṣaṣ prakāraḥ varānane
translated: The path that is deposited in the water pot, O beautiful-faced one, in six ways,

original: maṇḍale 'gnau śiśorantaḥ sādhāraṇavikalpitaḥ // / //🔽srucyadhvānaṃ tamāropya prāṇasthaṃ nāḍimadhyagam /🔽prāṇadhāre samīkṛtya srucā dhārāṃ vinikṣipet // / //
analyzed: maṇḍale gnau śiśoḥ antar sādhāraṇa vikalpitaḥ  sruci adhvānam tam āropya prāṇa stham nāḍi madhya gam  prāṇadhāre samīkṛtya srucā dhārām vinikṣipet

analyzed: sādhakam tatra saṃsthāpya sakalīkaraṇam tatas  nirbhatsya pūrvavat sarvaiḥ sādhya mantreṇa secayet
translated: Having installed the practitioner there, then the complete transformation,🔽Having sprinkled with all as before, one should sprinkle with the mantra to be accomplished.

original: nivṛtyāditribhiḥ kumbhaiḥ snāpayetpūrvadiṅmukham // / //🔽śāntyatītaṃ ghaṭaṃ paścād gṛhītvā secayecchiśum /
analyzed: nivṛti ādi tribhiḥ kumbhaiḥ snāpayet pūrva diś mukham  śānti atītam ghaṭam paścāt gṛhītvā secayet śiśum
translated: One should bathe facing the east with the three pots beginning with nivṛtti.🔽Then, having taken the pot of the transcendent peace, one should sprinkle the disciple.

analyzed: śāntim paścāt tu gṛhṇīyāt saṃpuṭena abhiṣecayet
translated: Afterwards, one should take the peace and consecrate with the combined.

analyzed: sādhakasya abhiṣekaḥ yam anuloma vilomataḥ
translated: This is the consecration of the practitioner, in the forward and reverse order.

analyzed: abhiṣicya praveśya enam dakṣiṇām mūrtim āsthitam
translated: Having consecrated, having made him enter, abiding in the southern form,

analyzed: praṇavena āsanam dattvā sakalīkaraṇam bhavet
translated: Having given the seat with the praṇava, there should be the complete transformation.

analyzed: sādhakasya adhikāra artham akṣamālā ādi kalpayet
translated: For the sake of the eligibility of the practitioner, one should imagine the rosary and other things.

analyzed: mantra kalpa akṣasūtram ca khaṭikām chatra pāduke
translated: The rosary of mantras, the thread, the water pot, the umbrella, the sandals,

analyzed: uṣṇīṣa rahitam da tvā praviśya śiva saṃnidhau
translated: Having given these without the turban, one should enter in the presence of Shiva.

analyzed: vijñāpya parameśānam sādhakaḥ yam mayā kṛtaḥ
translated: Having informed the Supreme Lord, this practitioner has been made by me.

analyzed: bhūyāt siddhiḥ tvad ājñātaḥ tri prakārasya bhaktitaḥ
translated: Let there be accomplishment through your command, with devotion to the three kinds.

analyzed: sādhya mantram dadet paścāt puṣpa udaka samanvitam
translated: Then one should give the mantra to be accomplished, along with flowers and water.

original: tasya haste samarpyeta siddhyarthaṃ sādhakasya tu // / //
analyzed: tasya haste samarpyeta siddhi artham sādhakasya tu
translated: It should be entrusted to his hand for the sake of accomplishment of the practitioner.

original: praṇamyobhau gṛhītvā tu mantraṃ hṛdi niveśayet /
analyzed: praṇamya ubhau gṛhītvā tu mantram hṛdi niveśayet
translated: Having bowed to both, having taken it, one should place the mantra in the heart.

analyzed: prahṛṣṭa vadanaḥ śiṣyaḥ guruḥ ca api praharṣavān
translated: The disciple with a cheerful face, and the teacher also delighted,

analyzed: agni āgāre sa avadhānau tarpayet mantra saṃhitām
translated: In the fire chamber, being attentive, they should offer oblations to the collection of mantras.

original: sahasraṃ vā śataṃ vāpi sādhyamantrasya tarpaṇam // / //
analyzed: sahasram vā śatam vā api sādhya mantrasya tarpaṇam
translated: The oblation of the mantra to be accomplished should be done a thousand or a hundred times.

original: evaṃ saṃtarpayitvā tu puṣpaṃ pāṇau pradāpayet /
analyzed: evam saṃtarpayitvā tu puṣpam pāṇau pradāpayet
translated: Having thus offered oblations, one should place a flower in the hand.

original: tristhaṃ saṃpūjya devaṃ tu tato 'pi triḥpradakṣiṇam // / //
analyzed: tristham saṃpūjya devam tu tris pradakṣiṇam
translated: Having worshipped the god in three places, then also circumambulating three times,

analyzed: praṇamya bhakti yukta ātmā aṇima ādi phalam labhet
translated: Having bowed with a mind full of devotion, one obtains the fruits like becoming as small as an atom and so on.

analyzed: utthāpya sādhakam brūyāt samayān pāhi yatnataḥ
translated: Having raised the adept, he should say, Protect the observances carefully.

original: dīkṣāvasāne te devi śrāvaṇīyā vipaścitā /🔽evaṃ dīkṣāṃ tu nirvartya sarvadaiva varānane // / //
analyzed: dīkṣā avasāne te devi śrāvaṇīyā vipaścitā  evam dīkṣām tu nirvartya sarvadā eva varānane
translated: O Goddess, at the end of the initiation, this should be heard by the wise:

analyzed: ātmatyāgaḥ prakartavyaḥ yathā bhavati tat śruṇu
translated: Thus, having completed the initiation, O beautiful-faced one, the renunciation of the self should be performed. Listen to how it happens.

analyzed: vaijñānakī prākṛtī vā ācāryasya yadṛcchayā
translated: Whether it is due to the knowledge of the teacher or naturally,

analyzed: vaijñānikīm su sūkṣmām tu vidhinā anena kārayet
translated: the subtle knowledge should be accomplished by this method.

analyzed: tila ājya ādi samāyuktā adhva vāgīśi kalpanā
translated: Conjoined with sesame seeds, ghee, and so on, the imagination of the path and the lord of speech,

analyzed: kalābhiḥ pañcabhiḥ vyāptam adhvānam yugapad nyaset
translated: the path pervaded by the five energies should be placed simultaneously.

analyzed: pūjā homa upacāra ādyān kṛtvā ātmānam niyojayet
translated: Having performed the worship, oblation, and other services, one should dedicate oneself.

analyzed: śiṣya caitanya vat yogāt adhvānam yugapad nyaset
translated: By the yoga of the consciousness of the disciple, the path should be placed simultaneously.

analyzed: puṣpa ādyaiḥ pūjayitvā tam yoga artham āhuti trayam
translated: Having worshipped him with flowers and so on, for the sake of yoga, three oblations should be offered.

analyzed: garbha dhāri tva janane arjane bhoga tad laye
translated: In the bearing of the embryo, in birth, in acquisition, in enjoyment, and in dissolution,

analyzed: yugapad homayet devi mūlamantreṇa suvrataḥ
translated: the one of good vows should simultaneously offer oblations with the root mantra, O Goddess.

analyzed: āhutīnām trayam homyam pratikarma varānane
translated: Three oblations should be offered for each rite, O beautiful-faced one.

analyzed: hotavyā niṣkṛtiḥ bhinnā pañca sthāna kalā ātmasu
translated: The expiation should be offered in the five places of the parts of the Kala.

original: śatamekaṃ tadarthaṃ vā niṣkṛtiḥ parikīrtitā /🔽viśleṣapāśacchedādye dhāmnaiva yugapaddhutiḥ // / //
analyzed: śatam ekam tad artham vā niṣkṛtiḥ parikīrtitā  viśleṣa pāśa cheda ādye dhāmnā eva yugapad dhutiḥ
translated: One hundred or one hundred and eight oblations are prescribed as the expiation.🔽In the first stage of cutting the bonds of separation, the oblation should be offered simultaneously with the abode.

analyzed: uddhāre ca ātma tattva sthe pūrṇāhutim tu pātayet
translated: And in the extraction, when established in the principle of the self, the full oblation should be offered.

analyzed: ātmānam yojayet tattve śive parama kāraṇe
translated: One should unite the self with the principle of Shiva, the supreme cause.

analyzed: guṇān pūrvavat āpādya amṛtān pūrvavat kuru
translated: Having added the qualities as before, make the immortal as before.

analyzed: ātma dīkṣā samāptau tu prāyaścitta nivṛttaye
translated: At the conclusion of the self-initiation, for the cessation of expiation,

analyzed: atha vijñāna rūpeṇa sakṛt uccāra lakṣaṇā
translated: Now, the characteristic of uttering once in the form of knowledge,

analyzed: heya upādeya pāśānām yugapad bhairaveṇa tu
translated: The simultaneous cutting of the bonds of what is to be abandoned and accepted by Bhairava,

original: śāśvatī saṃsthitiḥ paścāt sūkṣmadīkṣā prakīrtitā /🔽viśeṣapūjanaṃ homaṃ yathāśakti prakalpayet // / //
analyzed: śāśvatī saṃsthitiḥ paścāt sūkṣma dīkṣā prakīrtitā  viśeṣa pūjanam homam yathāśakti prakalpayet
translated: The eternal state afterwards is proclaimed as the subtle initiation.🔽One should perform the special worship and oblation according to one's ability.

analyzed: vādya gīta su nṛtya ādyaiḥ stutibhiḥ pūjayet haram
translated: One should worship Hara with musical instruments, singing, good dancing, and praises.

analyzed: tris pradakṣiṇam āvartya kalaśa agni sa maṇḍalam
translated: Having circumambulated the water pot, fire, and maṇḍala three times,

analyzed: aṣṭāṅgapatanam kṛtvā vijñapet parameśvaram
translated: Having prostrated with the eight limbs, one should request the Supreme Lord.

analyzed: bhagavan paśu hetu artham yena mayā āvāhitaḥ bhavān
translated: O Lord, you have been invoked by me for the sake of the animal sacrifice.

original: tatkṣantavyaṃ sadā deva vidhisthasya mama prabho /
analyzed: tat kṣantavyam sadā deva vidhi sthasya mama prabho
translated: That should always be forgiven by you, O God, O Lord, of me who am in the ritual.

analyzed: vidhi nyūnam akāmasya pūjā śāstā uditā yathā
translated: The worship as prescribed by the scriptures, even if incomplete, of one who is not desirous,

analyzed: na bhavet ati bhūyiṣṭhā prākṛtaiḥ dravya saṃcayaiḥ
translated: would not be excessive with the collection of ordinary substances.

analyzed: avalambya bhakti mātram vidhānam yat kṛtam mayā
translated: Whatever ritual has been performed by me, relying solely on devotion,

original: tatsarvaṃ saphalaṃ me 'stu suprasanne vibho tvayi /🔽prasannavadano hṛṣṭo varaṃ dattaṃ vibhāvayet // / //🔽upaviśya tato yāgaṃ saṃhareta kramāt priye /
analyzed: tat sarvam saphalam me stu su prasanne vibho tvayi  prasanna vadanaḥ hṛṣṭaḥ varam dattam vibhāvayet  upaviśya tatas yāgam saṃhareta kramāt priye
translated: may all that be fruitful for me, O Lord, when you are well pleased.🔽With a smiling face, delighted, he should consider the boon as granted.🔽Then, O beloved, having sat down, one should withdraw the sacrifice in due order.

analyzed: agram saṃprārthya gṛhṇīyāt sthāpayet ca astra rakṣitam
translated: Having requested the foremost, one should take it and place it protected by the weapon.

original: viśeṣapūjanaṃ cārdhaṃ praṇipātaṃ tataḥ punaḥ /🔽nirodhārdhaṃ tato gṛhya ardhaṃ savyāpasavyataḥ // / //
analyzed: viśeṣa pūjanam ca ardham praṇipātam tatas punar  nirodha ardham tatas gṛhya ardham savya apasavyataḥ
translated: And then the special worship, half of it, and then again prostration,🔽and then taking half of the obstruction, half from the right and left,

analyzed: da tvā visarjayet devam dhāma mantram anusmaran
translated: having given it, one should dismiss the god, remembering the dissolution mantra.

original: ātmano recakaṃ kṛtvā puṣpaṃ devāya ni /kṣipet // / //
analyzed: ātmanaḥ recakam kṛtvā puṣpam devāya nikṣipet
translated: Having exhaled from oneself, one should offer the flower to the god.

analyzed: saṃhāriṇyā ca saṃgṛhya mantrān pārśva vyavasthitān
translated: Having collected the mantras arranged on the sides with the saṃhāriṇī,

analyzed: vidyut vat calitān dhyātvā dhāma dehe tu vinyaset
translated: Having contemplated them as moving like lightning, one should deposit them in the body of the abode.

analyzed: vidyā deham bhairavasya tat līnam bindu vigrahe  bindum tu nāda śakti stham śakti rūpam tu grāhayet
translated: The embodied form of the Vidyā of Bhairava is merged in the form of the Point.

analyzed: śakti rūpam praṇava ubhaya saṃpuṭam
translated: The Point should be grasped as having the form of Śakti, residing in the power of Sound.🔽The form of Śakti, enveloped by the two Pranavas,

analyzed: saṃhāriṇyā tu saṃgṛhya dvādaśa ate tu yojayet
translated: having been collected by the Saṃhāriṇī (mantra), should be united with the twelve (vowels).

original: pūrakeṇa hṛdi nyasya svasthānasthaṃ tu bhāvayet /
analyzed: pūrakeṇa hṛdi nyasya sva sthāna stham tu bhāvayet
translated: Having deposited it in the heart with the Pūraka (inhalation), one should contemplate it as residing in its own place.

analyzed: sakalam niṣkalam rūpam tathā sakala niṣkalam
translated: The form is both Sakala (with parts) and Niṣkala (without parts), and also Sakala-Niṣkala (both with and without parts).

analyzed: bhinna avastham tu mantreṣu hṛd stham tat saṃsmaret priye
translated: The different states of the mantras should be remembered as residing in the heart, O beloved.

analyzed: visarjana vidhiḥ hi evam agnau evam prapūjayet
translated: The dismissal rite is thus. One should worship thus in the fire.

analyzed: aṣṭottaraśatam hutvā pūrṇāhutim prapātayet
translated: Having offered one hundred and eight oblations, one should offer the Pūrṇāhuti (complete oblation).
