translated: having collected the mass of mantras, one should arrange them in their respective places.

analyzed: jāgarayet tadā agnim tu nityakarma nimittataḥ
translated: One should keep that fire awake for the sake of the daily rites.

analyzed: nirmālya nayanam kuryāt rajāṃsi apaharet priye
translated: One should perform the removal of the remnants of worship and remove the dust, O beloved.

analyzed: tatas praviśya vasudhām prokṣayet tam śiva ambhasā
translated: Then, having entered the earth, one should sprinkle it with Shiva's water.

analyzed: bahis nirgatya bhūtānām bali karma tu pūrvavat
translated: Having gone out, one should perform the bali offering to the beings as before.

analyzed: ācamya sakalīkṛtya liṅginaḥ tarpayet tatas
translated: Having performed the achamana and made the linga complete, one should then offer oblations to the ascetics.

analyzed: gurum saṃpūjayet śiṣyaḥ yathā vibhava vistaraiḥ
translated: The disciple should worship the guru with wealth and elaborate offerings.

original: deśādhyakṣo grāmaśataṃ maṇḍaleśastadardhakam /🔽śatabhukpañca vai dadyād grāmaṃ viṃśatibhuktathā // / //
analyzed: deśa adhyakṣaḥ grāma śatam maṇḍala īśaḥ tad ardhakam  śata bhuj pañca vai dadyāt grāmam viṃśati bhuj tathā
translated: The lord of the region gets a hundred villages, the lord of the mandala gets half of that.🔽One who enjoys a hundred should give five, and one who enjoys twenty should give a village.

original: dadyāttu grāmabhuk kṣetraṃ kṣetrabhoktā tu viṃśatim /
analyzed: dadyāt tu grāma bhuj kṣetram kṣetra bhoktā tu viṃśatim
translated: One who enjoys a field should give a field, and one who enjoys twenty should give twenty.

analyzed: yena yena guruḥ tuṣyet tat sarvam vinivedayet
translated: One should offer everything with which the guru is pleased.

original: tatastvanṛṇatāṃ yāti vittaśāṭhyavivarjitaḥ /🔽tatastu samayāñśrāvyas tantre bhairavanirgate // / //
analyzed: tatas tu anṛṇa tām yāti vitta śāṭhya vivarjitaḥ  tatas tu samayān śrāvyaḥ tantre bhairava nirgate
translated: Then, free from deceit in wealth, one becomes free from debt.🔽Then, the observances should be taught in the tantra that has emerged from Bhairava.

analyzed: carukam prāśayet paścāt cumbakaḥ sādhakaiḥ saha
translated: Then, the adept should partake of the sacramental food along with the adepts.

analyzed: vāc niruddhaḥ prasanna ātmā pṛthak pātra vyavasthitaḥ
translated: With speech restrained, with a delighted mind, established in separate vessels,

analyzed: anukrameṇa dātavyaḥ tatas siddhim avāpnuyāt
translated: it should be given in sequence, then one will attain success.

analyzed: anena eva vidhānena dīkṣitāḥ ye varānante
translated: O excellent one, those who are initiated in this very manner in the end,

analyzed: brāhmaṇāḥ kṣatriyāḥ vaiśyāḥ śūdraḥ ca anye priye

analyzed: sarve te sama dharmāṇaḥ śiva dharme niyojitāḥ

analyzed: sarve jaṭā dharāḥ proktāḥ bhasma uddhūlita vigrahāḥ
translated: All of them are said to have matted hair, their bodies smeared with ashes,

analyzed: eka paṅkti bhujaḥ sarve samayinaḥ tu varānane
translated: all of them eat in a single row, O excellent one-faced one, the regular initiates.

analyzed: putrakāṇām bhavet ekā sādhakānām tathā bhavet
translated: There is only one for the spiritual sons, and likewise for the practitioners,

analyzed: cumbakānām bhavet ekā na prāk jāti vibhedataḥ
translated: there is only one for the magnetizers, not due to the difference in previous birth.

original: ekaiva sā smṛtā jātir bhairavīyā śivāvyayā /
analyzed: ekā eva sā smṛtā jātiḥ bhairavīyā śivā avyayā
translated: That one birth is remembered as the Bhairavi, the auspicious and imperishable one.

analyzed: tantram etat samāśritya prāc jātim na hi udīrayet
translated: Relying on this Tantra, one should not proclaim the previous birth.

analyzed: putrakāṇām sādhakānām tathā samayinām api
translated: For the spiritual sons, the practitioners, and likewise for the regular initiates,

original: prāgjātyudīraṇāddevi prāyaścittī bhavennaraḥ // / //🔽dinatrayaṃ tu rudrasya pañcāhaṃ keśavasya ca /
analyzed: prāk jāti udīraṇāt devi prāyaścittī bhavet naraḥ  dina trayam tu rudrasya pañca aham keśavasya ca
translated: O Goddess, a man becomes subject to expiation by proclaiming the previous birth.🔽For three days he is cooked in Rudra's hell, for five days in Keshava's,

original: pitāmahasya pakṣaikaṃ narake pacyate tu saḥ // / //
analyzed: pitāmahasya pakṣa ekam narake pacyate tu saḥ
translated: and for a fortnight in the Grandfather's hell.

analyzed: avivekī bhavet tasmāt yadi icchet uttamām gatim
translated: Therefore, one should not be indiscriminate if one desires the highest state.

analyzed: avivekena deveśi siddhiḥ muktiḥ dhruvam bhavet
translated: O Goddess of the gods, by non-discrimination, perfection and liberation will certainly occur.

analyzed: svacchandatantre caturthaḥ paṭalaḥ
translated: The fourth chapter of the Svacchanda Tantra

analyzed: pañcamaḥ paṭalaḥ  kalā dīkṣā sureśāna kathitā parameśvara
translated: The fifth chapter🔽O Lord of gods, the initiation of Kala and others has been described by the Supreme Lord.

analyzed: tattva dīkṣā samāsena kathayasva prasādataḥ
translated: Please explain the initiation of tattvas briefly out of grace.

analyzed: samāsāt kathayiṣyāmi tvad priya artham varānane
translated: O beautiful-faced one, for your pleasure, I will explain briefly

analyzed: ṣaṭtriṃśat tattva mukhyāni yathā śodhyāni pārvati
translated: how the main 36 tattvas and others should be purified, O Parvati.
Along with their own pervasion and conformity,

analyzed: yathā śuddhyā anti deveśi tathā te kathayāmi aham
translated: from earth to Shiva, O Goddess of the gods, I will explain how they are purified.

analyzed: vidyārājasya ye varṇāḥ nava saṃkhyā upalakṣitāḥ
translated: The syllables of the king of vidyas, marked by the number nine,

analyzed: vācakāḥ te ca tattvānām kathayāmi anupūrvaśas
translated: are the indicators of the tattvas. I will explain them in order.

analyzed: dharitrī ādi pradhāna antam ūkāraḥ vācakaḥ smṛtaḥ
translated: The syllable U is remembered as the indicator from earth to prakriti,

analyzed: puruṣasya yakāraḥ vai rāga tattva anvitasya ca
translated: the syllable Ya is for purusha endowed with the tattva of raaga,

analyzed: niśvāsa uttara
translated: cf. Nisvasa. Uttara.

analyzed: niyāmikām vakāreṇa vidyā tattva samanvitām
translated: The niyamikas endowed with the tattva of vidya are conceived by the syllable Va.

analyzed: kālam kalām lakāreṇa kalpayet tu varānane
translated: O beautiful-faced one, one should conceive time and kala by the syllable La.

original: māyātattvaṃ makāreṇa vidyātattvaṃ kṣakārataḥ /🔽repheṇa caiśvaraṃ tattvaṃ hakāreṇa sadāśivaḥ // / //
analyzed: repheṇa ca aiśvaram tattvam hakāreṇa sadāśivaḥ

analyzed: praṇavena tathā śaktiḥ nyasitavyā varānane

analyzed: vyāpinīm samanām ca ūrdhvam tatra eva tu viśodhayet
translated: One should purify the all-pervading and the equalizing above there only,

analyzed: śodhayitvā krameṇa eva mūlamantreṇa suvrate  yojyaḥ ātmā pare tattve unmanā atīta sarvage
translated: Having purified in due order by the root mantra, O good-vowed one,🔽The self is to be united in the supreme principle, beyond the mind and all-pervading,

original: nirābhāse pare śānte īśāne cāvyaye tvaje /
analyzed: nirābhāse pare śānte īśāne ca avyaye tu aje
translated: In the supreme, tranquil, lordly, imperishable, unborn, and non-apparent,

analyzed: ṣaṭtriṃśat tattvam ākhyātam nava tattvam pracakṣmahe
translated: The thirty-six principles have been explained. Now we shall explain the nine principles.

original: prakṛtiḥ puruṣaścaiva niyatiḥ kāla eva ca /
analyzed: prakṛtiḥ puruṣaḥ ca eva niyatiḥ kālaḥ eva ca
translated: Prakriti, Purusha, Niyati, Kala,

analyzed: māyā vidyā tathā īśaḥ ca sadāśiva śivau tathā
translated: Maya, Vidyā, Īśa, Sadāśiva, and Śiva,

analyzed: śodhayitvā tu vidhivat vyāptyā ātmānam niyojayet
translated: Having purified them according to the rules, one should unite one's self with the pervasion.

analyzed: pañcatattvī yadā śodhyā vaktra mantrāḥ tu vācakāḥ
translated: When the five principles are to be purified, the mantras of the faces are the indicators,

analyzed: śodhayet
translated: One should purify from earth up to space in that order.

original: kalānāṃ yāvatī vyāptis tattvānāṃ tāvadeva hi // / //
analyzed: kalānām yāvatī vyāptiḥ tattvānām tāvat eva hi
translated: The pervasion of the kalās is as much as that of the tattvas.

analyzed: tri tattvam adhunā vakṣye yathā śodhyam varānane
translated: Now I will tell you about the three principles, O beautiful lady, as they are to be purified.

analyzed: akāraḥ ātma tattvasya vācakaḥ parikīrtitaḥ
translated: The letter A is declared to be the denoter of the principle of the individual soul.

analyzed: māyā antam tat vijānīyāt vidyā ākhyasya api ukārakaḥ
translated: One should know that it extends up to Maya. The letter U is also the denoter of the principle called Vidyā.

analyzed: sakala avadhi tat jñeyam śivasya tu makārakaḥ
translated: One should know that it extends up to Sakala. The letter M is the denoter of Śiva.
The letter KṢ is the denoter of the Śiva principle, which is of the nature of the void.

analyzed: śodhayitvā krameṇa eva pare tattve niyojayet
translated: Having purified in due order, one should engage in the supreme principle.

analyzed: tattva dīkṣā samākhyātā catur bheda vyavasthitā
translated: The initiation into the principles has been explained, established with four divisions.

analyzed: para dīkṣām pravakṣyāmi yathāvat anupūrvaśas
translated: I will now explain the supreme initiation, in due order and as it truly is.

analyzed: vidyārāje tu ye varṇāḥ nava saṃkhyā upalakṣitāḥ
translated: The letters in the Vidyā Rāja, which are marked by the number nine,

original: pṛthagbhedena teṣāṃ tu vinyāsaṃ kathayāmi te // / //
analyzed: pṛthak bhedena teṣām tu vinyāsam kathayāmi te
translated: I will tell you their arrangement by individual division.

analyzed: nava nābham puram kṛtvā nava padma upalakṣitam
translated: Having made the city with nine naves, marked by nine lotuses,

analyzed: nava hastam likhet veśma aṣṭa parva adhikam budhaḥ
translated: The wise one should draw the house with nine cubits, with eight joints.

analyzed: sapta bhāgīkṛtam tat tu dakṣiṇa uttara bhājitam
translated: That is divided into seven parts, divided into south and north.

analyzed: caturaśram vibhajya ādau matsyaiḥ ca eva atra cihnitam
translated: Having first divided the square, it is marked here with fish.

analyzed: koṣṭhaka ekonapañcāśat sūtreṇa tu samālikhet
translated: One should draw forty-nine squares with a thread.

analyzed: madhyame koṣṭhake sūtram dvātriṃśa aṅgula sammitam
translated: In the middle square, the thread should be of thirty-two finger lengths.

analyzed: samālikhya mahādevi catur bhāga vibhājite
translated: O Great Goddess, having drawn it and divided it into four parts,

analyzed: prathame karṇikām kuryāt kesarāṇi dvitīyake
translated: in the first one, one should make the pericarp, in the second, the filaments,

analyzed: tṛtīye dala sandhīn ca dala agrāṇi caturthake
translated: in the third, the joints of the petals, and in the fourth, the tips of the petals.

original: dikṣu rekhāṣṭakaṃ dattvā pratidikṣu tathaiva ca // / //
analyzed: dikṣu rekhā aṣṭakam dattvā pratidikṣu tathā eva ca
translated: Having drawn eight lines in the directions and likewise in the intermediate directions,

analyzed: bhrāmayet caturaḥ vṛttān catur aṅgula sammitān
translated: one should rotate four circles of four finger lengths each.

original: dvābhyāṃ pratidigrekhābhyāṃ madhye sūtraṃ nidhāpya tat // / //🔽sūtrāgraṃ tu tato bhrāmyam ardhacandravidhānataḥ /
analyzed: dvābhyām pratidiś rekhābhyām madhye sūtram nidhāpya tat  sūtra agram tu tatas bhrāmyam ardhacandra vidhānataḥ
translated: Having placed the thread in the middle with two lines in the intermediate directions,🔽the tip of the thread should then be rotated according to the method of the half-moon.

analyzed: madhya sūtram ca dātavyam kiñjalka stham vipaścitā
translated: The wise one should place the middle thread in the middle of the filaments.

analyzed: pūrva patram itarāṇi evam eva hi
translated: Having drawn the eastern petal, the others should be done in the same way.

analyzed: kesarāṇi ca saṃlikhya caturviṃśati saṃkhyayā
translated: Having drawn the filaments numbering twenty-four,

analyzed: patra agratas nyaset lekhām vartulām tu su śobhanām
translated: one should place a beautiful circular line at the tip of the petal.

analyzed: tasya antam catur aśram tu kartavyam tad pramāṇataḥ
translated: Its end should be made square according to its measure.

original: pūrvaṃ brahma prasādhyaṃ tu viṣuvatsthena helinā /
analyzed: pūrvam brahma prasādhyam tu viṣuvat sthena helinā
translated: First, the Brahma point should be established by the heliocentric equinoctial point.

analyzed: pūrva paścāt tatam sūtram śaṅkunā sādhayet priye
translated: O Beloved, a thread should be stretched east-west and fixed with a peg.

analyzed: dvādaśa aṅgula mānena madhye śaṅkum praropya tam
translated: A peg should be planted in the middle at a distance of twelve finger-breadths.

original: pārśveṣu bhrāmayedrekhāṃ ṣoḍaśāṅgulasammitām // / //🔽pūrvāhne grāhayecchāyām aparasthāṃ sucihnitām /🔽aparasthena sūryeṇa prākchāyāṃ lāñchayet priye // / //
analyzed: pārśveṣu bhrāmayet rekhām ṣoḍaśa aṅgula sammitām  pūrvāhne grāhayet chāyām apara sthām su cihnitām  apara sthena sūryeṇa prāc chāyām lāñchayet priye
translated: A line should be drawn around it at a distance of sixteen finger-breadths.🔽In the morning, the shadow should be measured and well-marked on the western side.🔽O Beloved, the eastern shadow should be marked by the sun on the western side.

analyzed: dhruveṇa uttara dakṣa sthām lāñchayet tu varānane
translated: O Beautiful-faced One, the shadow should be marked by the north-east pole.

analyzed: tatas samālikhet padmam aṣṭa patram sa karṇikam
translated: Then, an eight-petaled lotus with a pericarp should be drawn.

analyzed: diś koṣṭhakān ca saṃgṛhya aṣṭa saṃkhyā upalakṣitam
translated: The directions and squares should be included, marked with the number eight.

analyzed: śeṣāḥ lopyāḥ varārohe eka antarita yogataḥ
translated: O Beautiful Lady, the rest should be erased, leaving an interval of one square.

original: padmāṣṭakaṃ tato dikṣu bāhye dvārāṇi cālikhet /
analyzed: padma aṣṭakam tatas dikṣu bāhye dvārāṇi ca ālikhet
translated: Then, in the directions outside, an eight-petaled lotus and doors should be drawn.

analyzed: vīthi ardha sammitām devi śobhām ca eva prakalpayet
translated: O Goddess, the beauty should be designed as half the width of the passage.

analyzed: upaśobhām ca tad mānām kapola antam samālikhet
translated: The sub-beauty should be drawn up to the cheek at the same measure.

analyzed: tathā kaṇṭham ca tad mānam dvāram etat prakīrtitam
translated: Similarly, the neck should be drawn at the same measure. This is declared as the door.

analyzed: dvāra aṣṭaka vibhāgena nava nābham puram smṛtam
translated: The city is said to have nine naves due to the division of the eight doors.

original: snātvā tu vidhivad devi praviśedbhavanaṃ guruḥ // / //
analyzed: snātvā tu vidhivat devi praviśet bhavanam guruḥ
translated: O Goddess, having bathed according to the rules, the Guru should enter the abode.

analyzed: pūrva uktena vidhānena sakalīkaraṇa ādikam
translated: As per the previously mentioned procedure, the rite of Sakalikarana (ritualistic sanctification) etc. should be performed.

analyzed: tatas sampūjayet devam bhairavam parameśvaram
translated: Then one should worship Lord Bhairava, the Supreme Lord.

analyzed: praṇavena āsanam dattvā śiva antam varavarṇini
translated: O beautiful lady, having offered the seat with Pranava (Om), up to Shiva,

analyzed: madhye sampūjayet devam svacchandam parameśvaram
translated: In the middle, one should worship Lord Svacchanda, the Supreme Lord.

analyzed: pūrva uktena vidhānena aṅga ṣaṭka samanvitam
translated: As per the previously mentioned procedure, along with the six limbs,

analyzed: pattra aṣṭake nyaset varṇān pūrva ādi īśān tatas kramāt
translated: One should place the letters in the eight petals, starting from the east up to the northeast, in order.

analyzed: sadāśivam hakāreṇa iti evamādi varānane
translated: O beautiful lady, Sadashiva with the letter Ha and so on,

analyzed: prakṛti antam vijānīyāt madhye pīṭha īśa kalpanā
translated: One should know up to Prakriti, and in the middle, the conception of the seat of the deities.

analyzed: diś padma karṇikā saṃsthān aṣṭau devān prapūjayet
translated: One should worship the eight deities residing in the pericarp of the lotus of the directions.

analyzed: tad sthāne bhairavaḥ pūjyaḥ śeṣāḥ varṇaiḥ yathākramam
translated: In their place, Bhairava should be worshipped, and the rest in order with the letters.

analyzed: śodhayet ca prakṛti ādi śiva antam surasundari
translated: O beautiful goddess, one should purify Prakriti and so on up to Shiva.

analyzed: īśāna diśaḥ ārabhya madhya pīṭham viśodhayet
translated: Starting from the northeast, one should purify the central seat.

analyzed: yojayet tu pare tattve śive parama kāraṇe
translated: One should then unite it with the supreme reality, Śiva, the supreme cause.

analyzed: evam varṇāḥ tathā mantrān bhuvanāni viśodhayet
translated: Thus, one should purify the letters, mantras, and worlds.

analyzed: kālāgni ādi śiva antam tu kalā vidhi samāśrayet
translated: One should resort to the method of parts, beginning with Kālāgni and ending with Śiva.

analyzed: samayān śrāvayet paścāt tantra āmnāya utthitān priye
translated: O Beloved, one should then recite the observances that have arisen from the scriptures and Tantras.

analyzed: na nindet bhairavam devam śāstram vā anya samudbhavam
translated: One should not criticize the Bhairava deity or the scriptures of other origins.

original: sāṃkhyaṃ yogaṃ pāñcarātraṃ vedāṃścaiva na nindayet // / //
analyzed: sāṃkhyam yogam pāñcarātram vedān ca eva na nindayet
translated: One should not criticize Sāṃkhya, Yoga, Pāñcarātra, or the Vedas.

analyzed: yatas śiva udbhavāḥ sarve hi apavarga phala pradāḥ
translated: Because all of them originate from Śiva and bestow the fruit of liberation.

analyzed: smārtam dharmam na nindet tu ācāra patha darśakam
translated: One should not criticize the Dharma based on Smṛtis, which shows the path of conduct.

analyzed: brahma ādi devatāḥ yāḥ ca mātaraḥ cumbakaḥ giriḥ
translated: The deities beginning with Brahmā, the mothers, the mountain of cumin,

analyzed: vīrāḥ ca eva bhaginyaḥ ca gāvaḥ bhūta gaṇāḥ tathā
translated: The heroes, the sisters, the cows, and the groups of spirits,

analyzed: deva dravyam na hiṃsyāt tu siddhānte yat vyavasthitam
translated: One should not harm the offerings to the gods, which are established in the Siddhānta.

analyzed: guroḥ annam na bhuñjīta adattam parameśvari
translated: O Supreme Goddess, one should not eat the food of the guru without offering it.

original: madyaṃ māṃsaṃ tathā matsyān anyāni ca varānane /
analyzed: madyam māṃsam tathā matsyān anyāni ca varānane
translated: Wine, meat, fish, and other things, O beautiful-faced one,

analyzed: sa ācārāḥ ca nirācārān liṅginaḥ na jugupsayet
translated: One should not despise those with good conduct or without conduct, or those who wear the linga.

analyzed: carukam prāśayan nityam gurūn sampūjayet sadā
translated: One should always offer the charu and worship the teachers.

original: upaskarān mahādevi pādena tu na saṃspṛśet // / //
analyzed: upaskarān mahādevi pādena tu na saṃspṛśet
translated: One should not touch the utensils with one's feet, O Great Goddess.

original: saṃhitāṃ cintayennityaṃ bhaktānāṃ śrāvayet sadā /🔽āhnikaṃ na vilumpettu sandhyākarma varānane // / //
analyzed: saṃhitām cintayet nityam bhaktānām śrāvayet sadā  āhnikam na vilumpet tu sandhyā karma varānane
translated: One should always contemplate the saṃhitā and explain it to the devotees.🔽One should not neglect the daily rites, O beautiful one, and should perform the evening rituals.

analyzed: a dīkṣitānām puratas na uccaret śāstra paddhatim
translated: One should not recite the scriptures in front of the uninitiated.

analyzed: tri kālam pūjayet devam japa dhyāna rataḥ sadā
translated: One should worship the Lord three times a day and be always engaged in japa and meditation.

analyzed: samayān pālayan nityam ubhaya artha phala īpsayā
translated: One should always observe the observances, desiring the fruits for both oneself and others.

analyzed: atas vijñāna dīkṣām tu pravakṣyāmi anupūrvaśas
translated: Therefore, I will now explain the initiation by knowledge in due order,

analyzed: adhyātma gati cāreṇa kevalena viśodhikām
translated: Which is purifying by the sole practice of the spiritual path.

analyzed: śiṣya ātmānam gṛhītvā tam ātma prāṇe niyojayet
translated: Having taken the disciple's self, one should merge it into one's own life force.

analyzed: abhimānam tathā uccārya kuryāt vai pūrvavat tadā
translated: Then, having uttered the conceit, one should do as before.

analyzed: udghātaiḥ ca tatas dhvānam śiṣyasya tu viśodhayet
translated: Then, with the exhalations, one should purify the disciple's path.

analyzed: tatas samuccaran tattvam pṛthivī ādyam tu suvrate
translated: Then, O one of good vows, uttering the tattva of earth etc.,

analyzed: bhinna abhinna svarūpeṇa ekaikam tu yathākramam
translated: One by one, in due order, with a nature that is both different and non-different.

original: sasvaraṃ hyakṣaroccāraṃ devatābhiḥ samanvitam /🔽bindunā śaktisaṃyogād udghātaḥ prathamaḥ smṛtaḥ // / //
analyzed: sa svaram hi akṣara uccāram devatābhiḥ samanvitam  bindunā śakti saṃyogāt udghātaḥ prathamaḥ smṛtaḥ
translated: The first exhalation is remembered as the utterance of the imperishable syllable with sound, along with the deities,
united with the dot and the power, devoid of the three deities, endowed with the end of the fourth,

original: udghātaḥ sa tu deveśi dvitīyaḥ parikīrtitaḥ // / //
analyzed: udghātaḥ sa tu deveśi dvitīyaḥ parikīrtitaḥ
translated: that exhalation, O Goddess of the gods, is declared to be the second,

analyzed: haṃsa akṣara samuccāraḥ su dīrghaḥ bindu saṃyutaḥ
translated: the utterance of the syllable of the Gander, very long, united with the dot,

analyzed: ardhacandrāt nirodhinyām udghātaḥ tu tṛtīyakaḥ
translated: from the half-moon, in the restraining, the third exhalation,

original: bhinnodghātau yadā devi nādāntastu tadā bhavet /
analyzed: bhinna udghātau yadā devi na adāntaḥ tu tadā bhavet
translated: when the exhalations are separate, O Goddess, then there is the end of sound,

original: udghātaḥ sa tu deveśi caturthaḥ parikīrtitaḥ // / //
analyzed: udghātaḥ sa tu deveśi caturthaḥ parikīrtitaḥ
translated: that exhalation, O Goddess of the gods, is declared to be the fourth,

analyzed: saḥ eva ca akṣara uccāraḥ vyāpinī ante vyavasthitaḥ
translated: that very utterance of the imperishable syllable, situated at the end of the Pervasive One,

original: udghātaḥ sa tu deveśi pañcamaḥ parikīrtitaḥ // / //
analyzed: udghātaḥ sa tu deveśi pañcamaḥ parikīrtitaḥ
translated: that exhalation, O Goddess of the gods, is declared to be the fifth,

analyzed: pañca udghātān tatas dattvā pṛthivīm śodhayet budhaḥ
translated: then, having given the five exhalations, the wise one should purify the earth,

analyzed: akāra ukāra makāra antam evam śuddhi ati na anyathā
translated: ending with the letters a, u, and m, thus it is purified, not otherwise.

original: śuddhe 'tha pārthive tattve cintitavyaṃ tu yogibhiḥ /
analyzed: śuddhe pārthive tattve cintitavyam tu yogibhiḥ
translated: When the earth principle is purified, it should be contemplated by the yogis,

analyzed: jalībhūtam tat eva etat ātmanā saha yogataḥ
translated: that very thing, having become water, along with the self, through yoga.

analyzed: jalībhūte punar mantrī tat eva catuḥ uccaret
translated: The mantra-holder, when the water has become liquid, should utter that very [mantra] four times,

analyzed: bindu antam dhāraṇā yuktam śiṣyāt ātmani cintayet
translated: ending with the bindu, endowed with retention, and imagine it in the disciple and in himself.

analyzed: śodhite toya saṃghāte tejaḥ bhūtam vicintayet
translated: When the mass of water has been purified, one should imagine it as having become fire.

analyzed: teja udghātāḥ trayaḥ teṣu nirodhi antam avasthitāḥ
translated: The three exhalations of fire are stopped and remain in them.

original: nāsti tejastato vāyur udghātadvayaśodhitaḥ /🔽ākāśe līyamānaṃ tam udghātena tu cintayet // / //
analyzed: na asti tejaḥ tatas vāyuḥ udghāta dvaya śodhitaḥ  ākāśe līyamānam tam udghātena tu cintayet
translated: Then there is no fire, purified by the two exhalations, it becomes air.🔽One should imagine that dissolving into space by the exhalation.

original: naṣṭe vāyau tataḥ śūnyam udghātaikena yojayet /
analyzed: naṣṭe vāyau tatas śūnyam udghāta ekena yojayet
translated: Then, when the air has disappeared, one should unite it with emptiness by one exhalation.

original: vyāpinī sā tu vijñeyā pañcamānte vyavasthitā // / //
analyzed: vyāpinī sā tu vijñeyā pañcama ante vyavasthitā
translated: That is to be known as the all-pervading, situated at the end of the fifth.

original: samanāyāṃ tato hyātmā tattvavyāpī sa ucyate /
analyzed: samanāyām tatas hi ātmā tattva vyāpī saḥ ucyate
translated: Then the self in the equalizing [breath] is said to pervade the principles.

original: ātmavyāpī tataścordhvaṃ sarvavyāpī tataḥ punaḥ // / //🔽tattvāntasaṃsthito hyātmā udghātaikena yogavit /
analyzed: ātmavyāpī tatas ca ūrdhvam sarvavyāpī tatas punar  tattva anta saṃsthitaḥ hi ātmā udghāta ekena yoga vid
translated: Then above that, pervading the self, and then again pervading all,🔽the self situated at the end of the principles, the knower of yoga,

analyzed: yojayet parame tattve unmanā atīta sarvage
translated: should unite by one exhalation in the supreme principle, transcending the mind and all-pervading.

original: yojanāṃ tu pare tattve śṛṇu devi vadāmyaham /
analyzed: yojanām tu pare tattve śṛṇu devi vadāmi aham
translated: Listen, O Goddess, I shall tell you about the union with the supreme principle.

analyzed: mantram uccārayet devi hrasvam dīrgham plutam param
translated: O Goddess, one should utter the mantra, short, long, and the supreme pluta.

original: parāparavibhāgena yāvattattvaṃ paraṃ gatam /🔽tridevaṃ bindusaṃyuktam ardhacandraṃ nirodhikām // / //
analyzed: para apara vibhāgena yāvat tattvam param gatam  tri devam bindu saṃyuktam ardhacandram nirodhikām
translated: The reality that has gone to the supreme state by the division of the higher and lower,🔽The three deities united with the bindu, the half-moon, the nirodhikā, the nāda,

analyzed: nādam ca śakti saṃyuktam vyāpinī samanā unmanāḥ
translated: And the power, the vyāpini, samanā, and unmanā,

analyzed: unmanā ca paraḥ ca eva sarvavyāpī śivaḥ vyayaḥ
translated: And the supreme unmanā, the all-pervading Śiva, the imperishable,

analyzed: jñātvā sarvam aśeṣeṇa vidhim eṣām yathākramam
translated: Having known all without exception, their procedure in due order,

original: tadā tu yojayenmantrī anyathā naiva yojayet // / //
analyzed: tadā tu yojayet mantrī anyathā nā eva yojayet
translated: Then the mantrin should unite, otherwise he should not unite at all.

original: bindusthaṃ tritayaṃ śabde caturtho bindureva hi /
analyzed: bindu stham tritayam śabde caturthaḥ binduḥ eva hi
translated: The triad located in the bindu, in the sound, the fourth is indeed the bindu itself.

original: brahmā viṣṇustathā rudraḥ trimāṇaṃ varṇa ucyate // / //
analyzed: brahmā viṣṇuḥ tathā rudraḥ tri māṇam varṇaḥ ucyate
translated: Brahmā, Viṣṇu, and Rudra are said to be the three measures of the syllable.

analyzed: īśvaraḥ bindudevaḥ tu kaṇṭhe śabdaḥ pravartate
translated: Īśvara is the bindu deity, the sound arises in the throat.

analyzed: tatra śabdaḥ kriyā anta sthaḥ kriyāśaktiḥ iti smṛtā
translated: There, the sound is said to be the power of action residing in the end of the action.

analyzed: sa śabdaḥ tāluke devi īritaḥ sampravartate
translated: That sound, O Goddess, is said to proceed to the palate.

analyzed: tasya kiṃcid gataḥ śabdaḥ nāsikā ante pravartate
translated: A little of that sound proceeds to the end of the nose.

analyzed: jñānaśaktiḥ tu vijñeyā yatnataḥ parameśvari
translated: The power of knowledge should be carefully known, O Supreme Goddess.

analyzed: mūrdha sthāna gataḥ śabdaḥ lalāṭa antam avasthitaḥ
translated: The sound located in the place of the head, remaining at the end of the forehead,

original: varṇaḥ śabdagataḥ teṣām udghātaḥ sa tu kīrtitaḥ /
analyzed: varṇaḥ śabda gataḥ teṣām udghātaḥ sa tu kīrtitaḥ
translated: Their color is in sound, and that is declared to be the exhalation.

analyzed: tatrasthāḥ vinivartante śiva jñāna vivarjitāḥ
translated: They who are devoid of the knowledge of Śiva turn back from there.

analyzed: pañcadhā avasthitaḥ binduḥ ardhacandraḥ nirodhikā
translated: The bindu is located in five ways, the half-moon is the obstructress.

analyzed: tasya atītaḥ bhavet nādaḥ avicchinnaḥ tu asau bhavet
translated: Beyond that, there would be the sound, which should be uninterrupted.

analyzed: īṣat prasārite vaktre devadevaḥ sadāśivaḥ
translated: In the mouth slightly opened, Sadāśiva, the god of gods,

analyzed: caturvidhaḥ bhavet śabdaḥ yaḥ su vega vahaḥ smṛtaḥ
translated: The sound would be of four kinds, which is known as having good speed.

analyzed: pañcamaḥ na vahet śabdaḥ ūrdhva gāminī asau smṛtā
translated: The fifth sound should not be carried, it is known as going upwards.

analyzed: tasya atītā bhavet śaktiḥ pañcadhā tu vyavasthitā
translated: Beyond that, there would be the power, which is indeed established in five ways.

analyzed: sparśaḥ tatra bhavet devi ātma vid tatra pūrvavat
translated: O Goddess, the touch would be there, the self-knowledge there is as before.

analyzed: vyāpinī paratas ca eva pañcadhā tu vyavasthitā
translated: The all-pervading one is also beyond that, which is indeed established in five ways.

original: vālāgramāśritaṃ sparśaṃ kadācidvetti vā na vā /
analyzed: vāla agram āśritam sparśam kadācid vetti vā na vā
translated: One may or may not sometimes experience the touch residing in the tip of a hair.

original: vyāpinī sā samuddiṣṭā na jñānaṃ parameśvari // / //
analyzed: vyāpinī sā samuddiṣṭā na jñānam parameśvari
translated: That is declared to be the all-pervading one, not the knowledge, O Supreme Goddess.

analyzed: tasya api samana atītā manaḥ tatra na kārayet
translated: One should not engage the mind there, which is beyond even that, the equal one.

analyzed: unmanā padam ārohan śuddha ātmā tu tatas bhavet
translated: Ascending to the state of the transcendent mind, one then becomes of pure self.

analyzed: śiṣya ātmānam guru vare unmanyante niyojayet
translated: The best of Gurus should engage the disciple's self in the state of Unmanī (beyond the mind).

analyzed: tatra yuktaḥ pare śānte mahāśāntim avāpnuyāt
translated: There, being united with the supreme peace, one attains great peace.

analyzed: guru pāramparāyātaḥ sampradāyaḥ prakāśitaḥ
translated: The tradition that has come down through the lineage of Gurus has been revealed.

original: yojane tu pare tattve upāyaḥ kathitastava // / //
analyzed: yojane tu pare tattve upāyaḥ kathitaḥ tava
translated: In the union with the supreme reality, the means has been told to you.

analyzed: evam jñātvā varārohe sarva karmāṇi kārayet
translated: O beautiful lady, knowing this, one should perform all the rites.

analyzed: tattvādhvānam kalādhvānam bhuvanādhvānam eva ca
translated: Having created the path of principles, the path of energies, and the path of worlds,

analyzed: varṇa mantra pada adhvānam kṛtvā evam śuddhi ati priye
translated: and the path of letters, mantras, and words, one becomes pure, O beloved.

original: eṣā vai dhāraṇādīkṣā kartavyā yoginātra tu // / //
analyzed: eṣā vai dhāraṇā dīkṣā kartavyā yoginā atra tu
translated: This is the initiation of retention, which should be performed here by the yogi.

original: mantrasiddhena vā devi kṛtā vai sukṛtā bhavet // / //
analyzed: mantra siddhena vā devi kṛtā vai su kṛtā bhavet
translated: Or, O Goddess, if performed by one who has accomplished mantras, it becomes well performed.

original: iti svacchandatantre tattvadīkṣāprakāśanaṃ nāma pañcamaḥ paṭalaḥ
analyzed: iti svacchandatantre tattvadīkṣāprakāśanam nāma pañcamaḥ paṭalaḥ
translated: Thus ends the fifth chapter named The Revelation of the Initiation of Principles in the Swachchanda Tantra.

analyzed: ṣaṣṭhaḥ paṭalaḥ  samayācāra yuktasya sādhakasya varānane
translated: Chapter 6🔽O beautiful-faced one, for the adept who is engaged in the conduct of the vow,

analyzed: jāyate vividhā siddhiḥ giri gahvaram āśrite
translated: various accomplishments arise by resorting to the mountain cave.

analyzed: su śuddhe bhū pradeśe tu sarva śalya vivarjite
translated: In a very pure place, devoid of all thorns,

original: pracchanne vijane ramye bhairavaṃ tatra pūjayet // / //
analyzed: pracchanne vijane ramye bhairavam tatra pūjayet
translated: in a secluded, delightful place, one should worship Bhairava there.

analyzed: japitvā akṣara lakṣam tu bahurūpasya suvrate
translated: O one of good vows, having muttered a lakh of syllables of the multi-formed one,

analyzed: pañca praṇava saṃyogāt japataḥ siddhyate dhruvam
translated: By the combination of the five Pranavas, the muttering is certainly accomplished.

original: mucyate na tu sandeho bhedanāt praṇavasya tu /
analyzed: mucyate na tu sandehaḥ bhedanāt praṇavasya tu
translated: But he is not liberated, due to the division of the Pranava.

original: hrasvaṃ dīrghaṃ plutaṃ sūkṣmam atisūkṣmaṃ paraṃ śivam // / //
analyzed: hrasvam dīrgham plutam sūkṣmam ati sūkṣmam param śivam
translated: The short, long, prolated, subtle, extremely subtle, supreme auspicious one...

original: praṇavaṃ pañcadhā jñātvā bhittvā mokṣo na saṃśayaḥ /
analyzed: praṇavam pañcadhā jñātvā bhittvā mokṣaḥ na saṃśayaḥ
translated: Having known the Pranava in five ways, by dividing it, there is liberation, there is no doubt.

analyzed: praṇavaḥ pañcadhā avasthaḥ haṃsena saha saṃyuktaḥ
translated: The Pranava is in five states, united with the Hamsa...

analyzed: yat kiñcid vāc mayam loke śiva jñāne pratiṣṭhitam
translated: Whatever is in the world of speech is established in the knowledge of Shiva.

analyzed: śiva jñānam ca tatrastham haṃsaḥ praṇava saṃyutaḥ
translated: And the knowledge of Shiva is there, the Hamsa united with the Pranava...

analyzed: vinā praṇava saṃyogāt jīvaḥ ekaḥ vyavasthitaḥ
translated: Without the union with the Pranava, the individual soul is established as one.

original: yathāprakṛti saṃyukto na ca tiṣṭhati caikataḥ // / //
analyzed: yathāprakṛti saṃyuktaḥ na ca tiṣṭhati ca ekatas
translated: As it is united with Prakriti, it does not remain alone...

original: tathā ṣaṣṭhena sambhinno dehe jīvaḥ pravartate /
analyzed: tathā ṣaṣṭhena sambhinnaḥ dehe jīvaḥ pravartate
translated: In the same way, the individual soul in the body functions when combined with the sixth.

original: coditastu yadā tena tadā cordhvaṃ pravartate // / //
analyzed: coditaḥ tu yadā tena tadā ca ūrdhvam pravartate
translated: When impelled by that, then it moves upwards...

analyzed: pratyakṣam api tat tattvam mahāmāyā vimohitāḥ
translated: Even though that reality is perceptible, those deluded by the great illusion

analyzed: kathitam nā abhijānanti vinā śāstreṇa codanām
translated: Do not know it, without the prompting of the scriptures...

analyzed: ṣaṣṭhaḥ ca ūrdhva vahaḥ jñeyaḥ svabhāva mukha saṃsthitaḥ
translated: The sixth one should be known as the upward-moving, abiding at the door of one's own nature.

analyzed: aprakāśaḥ sva deha sthaḥ guṇa bhūtaḥ pravartate
translated: Unmanifest, abiding in one's own body, functioning as a quality,

analyzed: nirguṇaḥ tu yadā devaḥ ekākī kāla varjitaḥ
translated: When the Lord is without qualities, alone, free from time,

original: vijñātavyaṃ na kiñcitsyāt kevalo niṣkalastu saḥ // / //
analyzed: vijñātavyam na kiñcid syāt kevalaḥ niṣkalaḥ tu saḥ
translated: Nothing should be known, he is only the partless one.

original: tasya rūpaṃ śarīraṃ ca nāsti varṇaḥ kriyā tathā /
analyzed: tasya rūpam śarīram ca na asti varṇaḥ kriyā tathā
translated: He has no form, body, color, or action.

original: sa kathaṃ gṛhyate sūkṣma agrāhyo nityamavyayaḥ // / //
analyzed: sa katham gṛhyate sūkṣmaḥ agrāhyaḥ nityam avyayaḥ
translated: How is he grasped, subtle, always ungraspable, immutable?

analyzed: etasmāt kāraṇāt devi ṣaṣṭham bījam niyojitam
translated: For this reason, O Goddess, the sixth seed is employed.

analyzed: pañca pañcaka saṃyuktaḥ dehe sakala niṣkalaḥ
translated: Endowed with the five sets of five, with body, both manifest and unmanifest,

original: grahaṇaṃ tu yadā tasya yogī yogavicintakaḥ /
analyzed: grahaṇam tu yadā tasya yogī yoga vicintakaḥ
translated: But when there is the grasping of him by the yogi, the thinker of yoga,

analyzed: yogena āvāhitasya api bhāva mātram tu bhāvayet
translated: Even though invoked by yoga, he should contemplate only the mere existence.

original: yadā karoti sṛṣṭiṃ ca ūrdhvaṃ binduḥ pravartate /
analyzed: yadā karoti sṛṣṭim ca ūrdhvam binduḥ pravartate
translated: When he creates, the drop moves upward.

analyzed: bindu upari ca yat śāntaḥ śivaḥ parama kāraṇam
translated: And above the drop is the tranquil Śiva, the supreme cause.

original: tatra bindurlayaṃ yāti tatsthānaṃ durlabhaṃ suraiḥ /
analyzed: tatra binduḥ layam yāti tat sthānam durlabham suraiḥ
translated: There the drop dissolves, that place is difficult to attain even for the gods.

analyzed: ṣaṣṭha svara samāyogāt abhyāsāt acirāt labhet
translated: By the combination with the sixth vowel, one would attain it soon by practice.

original: ṣaṣṭhaśca pañcamaścaiva tasya devi guṇāḥ smṛtāḥ /
analyzed: ṣaṣṭhaḥ ca pañcamaḥ ca eva tasya devi guṇāḥ smṛtāḥ
translated: The sixth and fifth are known as its qualities, O Goddess.

original: saguṇaḥ sakalo jñeyo nirguṇo niṣkalaḥ śivaḥ // / //
analyzed: sa guṇaḥ sakalaḥ jñeyaḥ nirguṇaḥ niṣkalaḥ śivaḥ
translated: The one with qualities should be known as the manifest, and Shiva as the formless one without qualities.

analyzed: sakalaḥ graha saṃyuktaḥ niṣkalaḥ bhāvam āśritaḥ
translated: The manifest one is associated with the planets, the formless one is based on the essence.

original: sakale japyamāne tu japto bhavati niṣkalaḥ // / //
analyzed: sakale japyamāne tu japtaḥ bhavati niṣkalaḥ
translated: When the manifest one is being repeated, it becomes the formless one that is being repeated.

analyzed: sura asurāṇām devena yajana upāya hetunā
translated: By the Lord, for the sake of the means of worship of the gods and demons,

original: rūpaṃ tu sakalaṃ tasya dvidhāvasthaṃ prakāśitam // / //
analyzed: rūpam tu sakalam tasya dvidhā avastham prakāśitam
translated: The manifest form of him is revealed in two states.

original: prathamaṃ prākṛtaṃ rūpaṃ vikṛtaṃ ca dvitīyakam /
analyzed: prathamam prākṛtam rūpam vikṛtam ca dvitīyakam
translated: The first is the natural form, and the second is the modified one.

analyzed: prakṛtiḥ vikṛtiḥ ca eva ubhe ṣaṣṭhena saṃyute
translated: Nature and modification, both are associated with the sixth.

original: ye padārthāḥ purā proktās tatrāsāvucchvasan muhuḥ /
analyzed: ye padārthāḥ purā proktāḥ tatra asau ucchvasan muhur
translated: The objects that were mentioned before, there he repeatedly breathes.

analyzed: pravartate ca etena punar tena nivartate
translated: And by this he proceeds, and again he turns back by that.

analyzed: praṇavaḥ pañcadhā avasthaḥ tri varṇaḥ ca tri daivataḥ
translated: The Praṇava is in five states, and has three letters and three deities.

original: bindunādasamāyuktaḥ praṇavaḥ paripaṭhyate // / //🔽akāraśca ukāraśca makāraśca tṛtīyakaḥ /
analyzed: bindu nāda samāyuktaḥ praṇavaḥ paripaṭhyate  akāraḥ ca ukāraḥ ca makāraḥ ca tṛtīyakaḥ
translated: Praṇava is recited as being endowed with the Bindu and Nāda.🔽The first is A, the second is U, and the third is M.

analyzed: varṇa trayam idam proktam brahma ādyāḥ devatāḥ trayaḥ
translated: This is said to be the three letters, and the three deities are Brahmā and others.

analyzed: bindu nāda samāyogāt īśvaraḥ ca sadāśivaḥ
translated: By the union of Bindu and Nada, there is Isvara and Sadasiva.

original: ete vai praṇavāḥ pañca haṃsaḥ prāṇayutaḥ sadā // / //
analyzed: ete vai praṇavāḥ pañca haṃsaḥ prāṇa yutaḥ sadā
translated: These are the five Pranavas, the Hamsa always united with Prana.

original: paramātmā śivo haṃsas tv apareṇa samanvitaḥ /
analyzed: paramātmā śivaḥ haṃsaḥ tu apareṇa samanvitaḥ
translated: The Supreme Self, Shiva, the Hamsa, is united with the other.

original: parataḥ praṇavān pañca punareva vadāmyaham // / //🔽śaktiśca vyāpinī caiva samanātmā ca niṣkalaḥ /
analyzed: paratas praṇavān pañca punar eva vadāmi aham  śaktiḥ ca vyāpinī ca eva samanā ātmā ca niṣkalaḥ
translated: Beyond that, I shall again speak of the five Pranavas.

original: unmanā ca tathā devi praṇavāḥ pañca kīrtitaḥ // / //
analyzed: unmanā ca tathā devi praṇavāḥ pañca kīrtitaḥ
translated: Shakti, Vyapini, Samana, the Unsurpassed, and Unmana - these are declared to be the five Pranavas.

original: parataḥ paramo haṃsaḥ sarvaṃ vyāpya vyavasthitaḥ /
analyzed: paratas paramaḥ haṃsaḥ sarvam vyāpya vyavasthitaḥ
translated: Beyond that, the Supreme Hamsa abides, pervading everything.

analyzed: ete vai praṇavāḥ pañca para apara vibhāgaśaḥ
translated: These are the five Pranavas, divided into supreme and non-supreme.

analyzed: parāpareṇa haṃsena nityam eva praṇāmitāḥ
translated: They are always bowed to by the supreme and non-supreme Hamsa.

analyzed: pravartante hi sarvatra bhukti mukti phala pradāḥ
translated: They function everywhere, bestowing the fruits of enjoyment and liberation.

analyzed: pañcabhiḥ tu yutaḥ tu ebhiḥ sa pañca praṇava ātmakaḥ
translated: He is united with these five, consisting of the five Pranavas.

analyzed: tatrasthaḥ eka rūpaḥ tu niṣkalaḥ tattvataḥ smṛtaḥ
translated: Abiding there, he is of one form, truly known as the Unsurpassed.

analyzed: tad yogāt api tat bījam sarva bīja prarohakam
translated: By that union, that seed, which causes the growth of all seeds,

analyzed: pravartate yatas yasmāt deva asura niketanam
translated: arises from which the abode of gods and demons proceeds.

original: tatra mantrāśca varṇāśca pratiṣṭhāṃ yānti nānyathā /
analyzed: tatra mantrāḥ ca varṇāḥ ca pratiṣṭhām yānti na anyathā
translated: There, mantras and letters attain stability, not otherwise.

analyzed: tasya boddhāt vimucyante ahi kañcuka vat priye
translated: O Beloved, they are released from that bondage, like the slough of a snake.

analyzed: tāvat bhramati saṃsāre yāvat tattvam na vindati
translated: One wanders in saṃsāra as long as one does not find that reality.

original: vidite tu pure tattve na bhūyo jāyate kvacit // / //
analyzed: vidite tu pure tattve na bhūyas jāyate kvacid
translated: But when the reality in the city is known, one is not born again anywhere.

analyzed: akṛtārthaḥ naraḥ tāvat yāvat haṃsam na vindati
translated: A man is not fulfilled as long as he does not find the Hamsa.

analyzed: praṇavena samāyuktam kṛtārthaḥ iti nirdiśet
translated: One should declare him to be fulfilled when he is endowed with Praṇava.

original: uccāraṃ ca tato jñātvā uccarettaṃ varānane /🔽uccārastrividho devi haṃsasya samudāhṛtaḥ // / //
analyzed: uccāram ca tatas jñātvā uccaret tam varānane  uccāraḥ trividhaḥ devi haṃsasya samudāhṛtaḥ
translated: Then, O beautiful-faced one, having known the utterance, one should utter it.🔽O Goddess, the utterance of the Hamsa is said to be of three kinds.

analyzed: hakāra ukāra saṃyukta bindu ante tu tṛtīyakaḥ
translated: The third is at the end of the Bindu, united with the letters Ha and O.

analyzed: sṛṣṭi nyāsena tu uccāraḥ saṃhāra yogaḥ ucyate
translated: The utterance is by the deposition of creation; the union is said to be by the yoga of dissolution.

analyzed: evamādi krameṇa eva mantram uccārayet budhaḥ
translated: In this way, the wise one should utter the mantra.

analyzed: bindu stham tritayam kṛtvā vaktram udghāṭayet tatas
translated: Having made the triad in the Bindu, one should then open the mouth.

analyzed: īṣat udghāṭite vaktre tadā nādam vijānata
translated: When the mouth is slightly opened, then one should know the Nāda.

original: nādasthaṃ pañcadhā caiva śaktisthaṃ pañcadhā punaḥ // / //
analyzed: nāda stham pañcadhā ca eva śakti stham pañcadhā punar
translated: The Nāda is of five kinds, and the Śakti is of five kinds again.

analyzed: vyāpinyām pañcadhā ca eva samanā niṣkala ātmanoḥ
translated: In the all-pervading, in five ways, of the Equalizing and the Formless,

original: unmanā ca paraṃ tattvaṃ sarvaṃ vyāpya vyavasthitam // / //
analyzed: unmanā ca param tattvam sarvam vyāpya vyavasthitam
translated: The Transmental and the Supreme Principle, pervading everything, are established.

analyzed: evam jñātvā vimucyante śivatattva vidaḥ janāḥ
translated: Knowing this, those who know the principle of Śiva are liberated.

original: anyathā naiva mucyante bindvante ye vyavasthitāḥ // / //🔽jyotīrūpaṃ tu bindusthaṃ nādasthaṃ śabdarūpakam /
analyzed: anyathā nā eva mucyante bindu ante ye vyavasthitāḥ  jyotī rūpam tu bindu stham nāda stham śabda rūpakam
translated: Otherwise, those who are established up to the Point are not liberated at all.🔽The form of light is in the Point, the form of sound is in the Sound,

analyzed: śakti stham sparśa gam ca eva tad ūrdhvam śūnya rūpakam
translated: The touch-based is in the Śakti, and above that is the form of emptiness.

original: brahmādipañcakaṃ yacca teṣāṃ śūnyaṃ ca tatpadam /
analyzed: brahma ādi pañcakam yat ca teṣām śūnyam ca tat padam
translated: And the group of five beginning with Brahmā, their state is emptiness.

analyzed: para apara vibhāgena te sarvatra vyavasthitāḥ
translated: They are all established everywhere by the division into supreme and inferior.

original: śūnyātītā tu samanā śuddhātmā tūnmanā tathā /
analyzed: śūnyātītā tu samanā śuddhātmā tu unmanā tathā
translated: The Equalizing is beyond emptiness, and the Transmental is the pure Self.

original: sarvātītaṃ paraṃ tattvaṃ sarvaṃ vyāpya vyavasthitam // / //
analyzed: sarva atītam param tattvam sarvam vyāpya vyavasthitam
translated: The supreme principle beyond all, pervading everything, is established.

analyzed: mantra rūpāḥ ca vijñeyāḥ bindu dharmāt tu devatāḥ
translated: The deities should be known as having the form of mantras due to the nature of the Point.

analyzed: tatrasthā sarva karmāṇi sādhayanti na saṃśayaḥ
translated: Residing there, they accomplish all actions, there is no doubt.

original: tattvaṃ ca unmanātmā tu samanā śūnyameva ca /
analyzed: tattvam ca unmanā ātmā tu samanā śūnyam eva ca
translated: The principle is the Transmental Self, the Equalizing is emptiness itself,

original: sparśaścaiva tathā śabdo rūpaṃ ca tadanantaram // / //
analyzed: sparśaḥ ca eva tathā śabdaḥ rūpam ca tad anantaram
translated: Touch, sound, and form, in that order.

original: mantrātmani sthitāḥ sarve jñātavyā daiśikena tu /
analyzed: mantra ātmani sthitāḥ sarve jñātavyāḥ daiśikena tu
translated: All of them should be known by the teacher to be present in the nature of mantra.

analyzed: tatrasthāḥ jñāna yogam ca prayacchanti varānane
translated: O beautiful-faced one, they bestow the yoga of knowledge while residing there.

analyzed: karma kāle tu sakalān śiraḥ pāṇi ādibhiḥ yutān
translated: At the time of ritual, one should recite the complete mantras along with the head, hands, and so on.

original: japet tu sakalān devi niṣkalena samanvitān // / //
analyzed: japet tu sakalān devi niṣkalena samanvitān
translated: O Goddess, one should recite the complete mantras endowed with the formless.

analyzed: dhyāyet jyotiḥ mayān sarvān śabda siddhi pradāyakān
translated: One should meditate on all of them as consisting of light, bestowers of the accomplishment of sound.

original: śaktisthāḥ śaktidāḥ proktāḥ śūnyasthā vyāpakāḥ smṛtāḥ // / //🔽kramājjñānapradāste vai samanāsthā varānane /
analyzed: śakti sthāḥ śakti dāḥ proktāḥ śūnya sthāḥ vyāpakāḥ smṛtāḥ  kramāt jñāna pradāḥ te vai samanā sthāḥ varānane
translated: They are said to be bestowers of power when residing in power, and are known as all-pervading when residing in emptiness.🔽In due order, they bestow knowledge, O beautiful-faced one, when residing in the equalizing breath.

analyzed: kaivalya dāḥ tatas ca ūrdhve sarvajñāḥ ca unmane pade
translated: Beyond that, they bestow liberation when residing in the supreme state, and are omniscient in the state of the supreme state.

original: tattvena vedhitāḥ sarve ye mayā parikīrtitāḥ /
analyzed: tattvena vedhitāḥ sarve ye mayā parikīrtitāḥ
translated: All of them, as declared by me, are penetrated by reality.

original: tajjñātvā siddhidāḥ sarve muktidāśca na saṃśayaḥ // / //
analyzed: tat jñātvā siddhi dāḥ sarve mukti dāḥ ca na saṃśayaḥ
translated: Knowing that, they bestow all accomplishments and liberation, there is no doubt.

analyzed: pañca praṇava saṃyuktam tattvam te kathitam mayā
translated: I have told you the truth, united with the five Pranavas.

analyzed: pañca praṇava pūrveṇa oṃkāra ādi ayutena tu
translated: With the five Pranavas at the beginning, united with the syllable Om at the beginning,

analyzed: namaskāra avasānena bahu rūpeṇa suvrate
translated: with the conclusion of salutations, O multi-formed one of good vows,

analyzed: japataḥ siddhim āpnoti lakṣena akṣara saṃkhyayā
translated: By reciting one lakh times, one attains accomplishment.

analyzed: praṇava ādyena saṃyuktam mantram evam japet sadā

translated: O Goddess, among the ten, the triad of channels is mentioned as supreme.🔽The two are said to consist of the bindu and nada, while the middle one is known as having the nature of Shakti.

analyzed: hṛccakre tu samākhyātāḥ sādhakānām hita āvahāḥ
translated: They are known in the heart chakra, which is beneficial for the practitioners.

analyzed: prāṇaḥ vai carate tāsu ahar rātra vibhāgataḥ
translated: The prana moves in them according to the division of day and night.

analyzed: tathā te kathayiṣyāmi pravibhajya yathāsphuṭam
translated: I will tell you that in detail, so that it becomes clear.

analyzed: prabhu śakti samākṛṣṭāḥ marut prāṇa ātma saṃsthitāḥ
translated: Attracted by the power of the Lord, the winds are established in the form of prana.

analyzed: trayaḥ ete vibhāgena saṃcarante samantataḥ
translated: These three move everywhere without distinction.

analyzed: adhas ūrdhvam vahet yasmāt sarva nāḍīḥ pravāhayan
translated: Since it moves below and above, carrying all the channels,

analyzed: vṛtti saṃjñā prabhedena varṇa rūpāṇi anekadhā
translated: in various forms of letters, by the division of the names of vrttis (functions),

analyzed: dvāsaptati sahasrebhyaḥ jāyante daśa vai priye
translated: ten are born from seventy-two thousand, O Beloved.

analyzed: koṭi dhātar varārohe saḥ ekaḥ saṃvyavasthitaḥ
translated: O Beautiful Lady, that one is established as a crore of dhatus.

analyzed: prāṇa apāna mayaḥ prāṇaḥ visarga āpūraṇam prati
translated: Prana is made of prana and apana, in relation to exhalation and inhalation.

analyzed: nityam āpūrayan eva prāṇinām urasi sthitaḥ
translated: Always filling the chest of living beings, it remains.

original: prāṇanaṃ kurute yasmāt tasmāt prāṇaḥ prakīrtitaḥ /
analyzed: prāṇanam kurute yasmāt tasmāt prāṇaḥ prakīrtitaḥ
translated: Since it causes breathing, it is declared as prana.

analyzed: ahorātra gatim prāṇe adhunā kathayāmi te
translated: Now I shall tell you about the movement of day and night in prana.

original: tuṭayaḥ ṣoḍaśa prāṇe pūrvaṃ hi kathitā mayā /
analyzed: tuṭayaḥ ṣoḍaśa prāṇe pūrvam hi kathitāḥ mayā
translated: Sixteen tuts have been mentioned by me earlier in prana.

original: bāhye naiva tu kālena te lavāḥ parikīrtitāḥ // / //
analyzed: bāhye nā eva tu kālena te lavāḥ parikīrtitāḥ
translated: They are declared as lavas in external time.

analyzed: tābhiḥ catasṛbhiḥ devi prāṇe yāmaḥ vidhīyate
translated: O Goddess, a yama is formed in prana by those four.

analyzed: taiḥ eva praharaiḥ devi caturbhiḥ tu dinam bhavet
translated: O Goddess, a day would be with those very four praharas.

analyzed: rātriḥ caturbhiḥ vijñeyā ahorātraḥ tu atas ṣṭabhiḥ
translated: Night should be known as four, and day and night together as eight.

original: śivo dharmeṇa haṃsastu sūryā haṃsaḥ prabhānvitaḥ // / //
analyzed: śivaḥ dharmeṇa haṃsaḥ tu sūryāḥ haṃsaḥ prabhā anvitaḥ
translated: Shiva is with dharma, the swan is with the sun, the swan is endowed with radiance.

original: ātmā vai haṃsa ityuktaḥ prāṇo haṃsasamanvitaḥ /
analyzed: ātmā vai haṃsaḥ iti uktaḥ prāṇaḥ haṃsa samanvitaḥ
translated: The self is said to be the swan, the prana is endowed with the swan.

analyzed: tasya udayāt kalet kālaḥ grahāṇām udayaḥ bhavet
translated: From its rise, time would move, the rise of the planets would occur.

analyzed: ṛkṣāṇi rāśayaḥ ca eva tārāḥ tu aṃśāḥ tathā eva ca
translated: The lunar mansions, the signs, the stars, and the lunar days,

analyzed: prāṇe vai udayanti ete ahorātreṇa suvrate
translated: these rise in prana, O one of good vows, in a day and night.

analyzed: vibhāgam kathayāmi te
translated: I shall tell you the division according to the rising and setting of day and night.

original: hṛdayordhve tu kaṇṭhādho yāvadvai pravahet priye // / //
analyzed: hṛdaya ūrdhve tu kaṇṭha adhas yāvat vai pravahet priye
translated: O Beloved, from the heart upwards and below the throat, as far as it flows,

original: aṅgulena vihīne tu prathamaḥ praharaḥ smṛtaḥ /
analyzed: aṅgulena vihīne tu prathamaḥ praharaḥ smṛtaḥ
translated: When it is devoid of finger-breadths, the first watch is remembered.

analyzed: dvitīyaḥ ūrdhve vijñeyaḥ madhyāhnaḥ tālu madhyataḥ
translated: The second should be known above, and midday is from the middle of the palate.

original: atra homo japo dhyānaṃ kṛtaṃ vai mokṣadaṃ bhavet /
analyzed: atra homaḥ japaḥ dhyānam kṛtam vai mokṣa dam bhavet
translated: Here, oblation, japa, and meditation, if done, would indeed bestow liberation.

analyzed: nāsā agrya tri aṅgula ūrdhve tu yāvat prāptaḥ tu suvrate
translated: O One of Good Vows, as far as it reaches above the tip of the nose and three finger-breadths,

analyzed: praharaḥ tu tṛtīyaḥ sau bhavet vai varavarṇini
translated: That is the third watch, indeed, O One of Excellent Complexion.

original: śaktyante ca caturthastu praharo 'haḥ prakīrtitam // / //🔽caturthānte tu deveśi prāṇasūryaḥ sadāstagaḥ /
analyzed: śakti ante ca caturthaḥ tu praharaḥ haḥ prakīrtitam
translated: And the fourth watch is declared to be the day, up to the end of Shakta.🔽O Mistress of the Gods, at the end of the fourth, the sun of the vital breath always sets.

analyzed: tatas stamaya sandhyā atra tuṭi ardham tu bhavet priye
translated: Then, O Beloved, the evening twilight lasts for half a tuti.

analyzed: tad kālam tu vilambya evam punar ca adhas pravartate
translated: Having delayed that time, it then proceeds downwards again.

original: sa ca candrodayo devi rajanī ca vidhīyate // / //
analyzed: sa ca candra udayaḥ devi rajanī ca vidhīyate
translated: And that is the rising of the moon, O Goddess, and night is declared.

analyzed: pūrva ukta krama yogena yāmeṣu evam carati asau
translated: In this way, it moves in the watches according to the sequence described earlier.

analyzed: tāluke ca ardha rātraḥ tu punar evam vidhīyate
translated: And midnight is again declared to be in the palate.

analyzed: hṛd padmam tu yadā prāptaḥ prabhāta samayaḥ tadā
translated: When it reaches the lotus of the heart, that is the time of dawn.

analyzed: tuṭi ardham tu varārohe pūrvasaṃdhyā bhavet tatas
translated: O beautiful lady, then half a tuți is the morning twilight.

analyzed: tasmāt samudayaḥ ca eva sūryasya sa bhavet punar
translated: From that, the rising of the sun also occurs.

original: pūrvavat kramayogena sa careddhi sadā śubhe // / //
analyzed: pūrvavat krama yogena sa caret hi sadā śubhe
translated: As before, in the union of the sequence, he should always move auspiciously.

analyzed: vāsare tu caret sūryaḥ dhārāyām saṃcaret śaśī
translated: The sun moves during the day, and the moon moves in the stream.

analyzed: candra sūrya udayaḥ hi eṣa mayā te parikīrtitaḥ
translated: This is the rising of the moon and sun, declared by me.

original: bhaumādyāśca grahā hyevaṃ caranti pravibhāgaśaḥ /🔽prāṇe cāpyudayantyete prahare prahare priye // / //
analyzed: bhauma ādyāḥ ca grahāḥ hi evam caranti pravibhāgaśaḥ  prāṇe ca api udayanti ete prahare prahare priye
translated: The planets beginning with Mars move thus in divisions.🔽O beloved, they rise in the breath in each watch.

analyzed: velā vāraḥ bhavet yasya sa caret prahara dvayam
translated: One should move for two watches at the time of which planet.

original: rāhuścarati somena ketuścarati bhāsvatā // / //🔽ye grahāste ca vai nāgā lokapālāṣṭakaṃ ca te /
analyzed: rāhuḥ carati somena ketuḥ carati bhāsvatā  ye grahāḥ te ca vai nāgāḥ lokapāla aṣṭakam ca te
translated: Rahu moves with the moon, and Ketu moves with the sun.🔽Those planets are indeed the nāgas, and they are the eight guardians of the world.

original: mūrtayaścaiva te cāṣṭāv aṣṭau te ca gaṇeśvarāḥ // / //
analyzed: mūrtayaḥ ca eva te ca aṣṭau aṣṭau te ca gaṇeśvarāḥ
translated: They are the eight forms, and they are the eight lords of the Gaṇas.

original: te ca pañcāṣṭakā rudrās tathā yogāṣṭakāḥ pare /
analyzed: te ca pañca aṣṭakāḥ rudrāḥ tathā yoga aṣṭakāḥ pare
translated: They are the five groups of eight Rudras, and the other eight are the groups of eight Yogas.

analyzed: ananta ādi śikhaṇḍi antāḥ te ca vidyeśvara aṣṭakāḥ
translated: They are the eight lords of knowledge, from Ananta to Śikhaṇḍin.

analyzed: sakala ādyāni tattvāni sthitāni paratas tu iha
translated: The principles beginning with Sakala exist here in the supreme.

original: pūrvoktā bhairavāścāṣṭau sarve te ca vyavasthitāḥ // / //
analyzed: pūrva uktāḥ bhairavāḥ ca aṣṭau sarve te ca vyavasthitāḥ
translated: The previously mentioned eight Bhairavas, all of them, are established here.

analyzed: graha ādīn samadhiṣṭhāya sarveṣu udaya kārakāḥ
translated: Dominating the planets and others, they are the causes of the rise of all.

original: rāśibhiḥ saha nakṣatrais ta udyanti aharniśam // / //
analyzed: rāśibhiḥ saha nakṣatraiḥ te udyanti aharniśam
translated: Along with the signs and constellations, they rise day and night.

analyzed: madhyāhne ca ardharātre ca udayaḥ bhijitaḥ bhavet
translated: At midday and midnight, there is the rise of Abhijit.

analyzed: abhīpsitam phalam tatra sādhakānām bhavet iha
translated: There, the desired fruits will be for the practitioners here.

analyzed: ahorātra vibhāgaḥ yam evam te kathitaḥ mayā
translated: Thus, this division of day and night has been told to you by me.

original: adhunā pakṣamāsāṃśca varṣāṇi kathayāmi te // / //🔽ādhyātmikāhorātreṇa bāhye kāṣṭhā vidhīyate /
analyzed: adhunā pakṣa māsān ca varṣāṇi kathayāmi te  ādhyātmika ahorātreṇa bāhye kāṣṭhā vidhīyate
translated: Now I shall tell you about the fortnights, months, and years.🔽The external division of hours is made by the internal day and night.

analyzed: māsena ādhyātmikena eva bāhye ca eva kalā bhavet
translated: The external division of kalas is made by the internal month alone.

analyzed: tatra triṃśat ahorātrāḥ māsaḥ tu varavarṇini
translated: There, O best of women, a month is thirty days and nights.

original: māsaidvadaśabhiścaiva bāhye 'tha ghaṭikā bhavet // / //🔽śatāni trīṇyahotrātrāḥ ṣaṣṭireva tathādhikā /
analyzed: bāhye ghaṭikā bhavet  śatāni trīṇi ahar trātrāḥ ṣaṣṭiḥ eva tathā adhikā
translated: And by twelve months, the external ghatikas are made.

original: varṣametat samākhyātaṃ bāhye vai ghaṭikā ca sā // / //
analyzed: varṣam etat samākhyātam bāhye vai ghaṭikā ca sā
translated: Three hundred and sixty days and nights make up this year, which is one ghatika externally.

original: ghaṭikāḥ ṣaṣṭistvahorātre bāhye tu pravahanti vai /
analyzed: ghaṭikāḥ ṣaṣṭiḥ tu ahorātre bāhye tu pravahanti vai
translated: Sixty ghatikas make one day and night externally,

analyzed: tāḥ eva antara cāreṇa ṣaṣṭiḥ saṃvatsarāḥ smṛtāḥ
translated: And those same [ghatikas] are known as sixty years by internal movement.

analyzed: prāṇa saṃkhyām punar teṣu kathayāmi adhunā tava
translated: Now I shall tell you the number of breaths in them.

analyzed: ṣaḍ śatāni varārohe sahasrāṇi ekaviṃśatiḥ
translated: O beautiful lady, there are twenty-one thousand and six hundred,

analyzed: ahorātreṇa bāhyena adhyātmam tu saradhipe
translated: By the external day and night, but internally, O ruler of the gods.

analyzed: prāṇa saṃkhyā samākhyātā jñātavyā sādhakena tu
translated: The number of breaths has been declared; it should be known by the practitioner.

analyzed: sadā līnaḥ sādhakaḥ para tattva vid
translated: The practitioner who knows the supreme truth is always absorbed in the Pranahansa (the swan of life-force).

original: tasyāyaṃ japa uddiṣṭaḥ siddhimuktiphalapradaḥ // / //🔽adhaḥ pravahaṇe siddhir hṛtpadmaṃ yāvadāgataḥ /
analyzed: tasya ayam japaḥ uddiṣṭaḥ siddhi mukti phala pradaḥ  adhas pravahaṇe siddhiḥ hṛd padmam yāvat āgataḥ
translated: His japa (repetition of the Pranahansa) is prescribed, which bestows the fruits of perfection and liberation.🔽Perfection is attained as far as the lotus of the heart in the downward flow.

analyzed: muktiḥ ca eva bhavet ūrdhve para tattve tu suvrate
translated: And liberation is in the upward flow, in the supreme truth, O one of good vows.

analyzed: manaḥ pi anyatra nikṣiptam cakṣuḥ anyatra pātitam
translated: Even when the mind is placed elsewhere and the eyes are cast elsewhere,

original: yathā pravartate prāṇas tv ayatnādeva sarvadā // / //
analyzed: yathā pravartate prāṇaḥ tu ayatnāt eva sarvadā
translated: The life-force always flows effortlessly.

analyzed: na asya uccārayitā kaścid pratihantā na vidyate
translated: No one utters it, and no one obstructs it.

analyzed: svayam uccarate haṃsaḥ prāṇinām urasi sthitaḥ
translated: The Hamsa (the swan of life-force) resides in the chest of living beings and utters itself.

original: māsavatsarasaṃkhyā tu eṣā te kathitā mayā /
analyzed: māsa vatsara saṃkhyā tu eṣā te kathitā mayā
translated: This number of months and years has been told to you by me.

analyzed: candra sūrya uparāgam tu kathayāmi tatas param
translated: After this, I will tell you about the lunar and solar eclipses.

analyzed: ahorātraḥ tu yaḥ proktaḥ prāṇe smin surasundari
translated: O beautiful goddess, the day and night that are said to be in this life-force,

original: sa eva pakṣadvitayaṃ māsaṃ ca kathayāmi te // / //
analyzed: saḥ eva pakṣa dvitayam māsam ca kathayāmi te
translated: I will tell you that very thing is two fortnights and a month.

analyzed: tuṭi ardham ca api adhas ca ūrdhvam viśramaḥ parikīrtitaḥ
translated: Half a tuți is said to be the rest below and above.

analyzed: madhye pañcadaśa uktāḥ yāḥ tithayaḥ tāḥ prakīrtitāḥ
translated: The fifteen lunar days that are said to be in the middle are declared.

original: prathamodaye tu hṛtpadmāt tuṭyardhaṃ tu dinaṃ bhavet /
analyzed: prathama udaye tu hṛd padmāt tuṭi ardham tu dinam bhavet
translated: In the first rise, half a tuți is the day from the lotus of the heart.

original: dvitīye caiva tuṭyardhe yadā carati śarvarī // / //
analyzed: dvitīye ca eva tuṭi ardhe yadā carati śarvarī
translated: And in the second half tuți, when night moves,

analyzed: rāśayaḥ graha nakṣatrāṇi udayanti yathākramam
translated: The signs, planets, and stars rise in order.

analyzed: asmin evam ahorātre pūrvavat ca varānane
translated: In this very day and night, O beautiful one, as before,

original: tuṭibhiḥ pañcadaśabhiḥ pakṣaḥ sa tu vidhīyate /
analyzed: tuṭibhiḥ pañcadaśabhiḥ pakṣaḥ sa tu vidhīyate
translated: A fortnight is said to be with fifteen tuțis.

original: tithicchede ṛṇaṃ jñeyaṃ vṛddhau caiva dhanaṃ bhavet // / //
analyzed: tithi chede ṛṇam jñeyam vṛddhau ca eva dhanam bhavet
translated: When the lunar day is cut off, it should be known as debt, and in increase, it is wealth.

original: ṛṇaṃ caiva bhavetkāso niḥśvāso dhana ucyate /
analyzed: ṛṇam ca eva bhavet kāsaḥ niḥśvāsaḥ dhanaḥ ucyate
translated: Cough is said to be debt, and exhalation is said to be wealth.

analyzed: bhavet
translated: By the upward movement in the dark fortnight, there would be dissolution and destruction.

analyzed: krūra karmāṇi vai tatra kurvan siddhim avāpnuyāt
translated: One who performs cruel acts there will attain success.

original: śubhakarmāṇi kṛṣṇe ca na ca siddhyanti suvrate // / //
analyzed: śubha karmāṇi kṛṣṇe ca na ca siddhyanti suvrate
translated: Auspicious acts are not successful in Krishna, O you of good vows.

original: śaktiṃ vai viśati prāṇe yā tuṭistu vidhīyate /
analyzed: śaktim vai viśati prāṇe yā tuṭiḥ tu vidhīyate
translated: The energy that enters the vital breath is called a tuti.

original: amāvasyā tu sā jñeyā kṛṣṇapakṣe varānane // / //
analyzed: amāvasyā tu sā jñeyā kṛṣṇa pakṣe varānane
translated: That should be known as the new moon day in the dark fortnight, O beautiful-faced one.

analyzed: śakteḥ madhya ūrdhva bhāge tu tuṭi ardham yat prakīrtitam
translated: In the middle and upper part of the energy, the half tuti is proclaimed.

analyzed: pakṣasaṃdhiḥ tu asau jñeyaḥ māvasya ardha pratipadā
translated: That should be known as the conjunction of the lunar fortnights, the new moon and the first lunar day.

original: tithicchedena vai tatra sūryasya grahaṇaṃ bhavet /
analyzed: tithi chedena vai tatra sūryasya grahaṇam bhavet
translated: There, the eclipse of the sun occurs due to the interruption of the lunar day.

analyzed: ravi bimba antare devi candra bimbam tadā bhavet
translated: O Goddess, at that time, the orb of the moon is within the orb of the sun.

analyzed: tad antare bhavet rāhuḥ amṛta arthī varānane
translated: O beautiful-faced one, Rahu, desiring nectar, is within that.

original: amṛtaṃ sravate candro rāhuśca grasate tu tam // / //
analyzed: amṛtam sravate candraḥ rāhuḥ ca grasate tu tam
translated: The moon exudes nectar, and Rahu swallows it.

original: pītvā tyajati tadlimbaṃ tadā muktaḥ sa ucyate /
analyzed: pītvā tyajati tad limbam tadā muktaḥ saḥ ucyate
translated: Having drunk it, he abandons that orb, and then he is said to be released.

original: ādityagrahaṇaṃ caiva loke tadupadiśyate // / //🔽rāhurādityacandrau ca traya ete grahā yadā /
analyzed: āditya grahaṇam ca eva loke tat upadiśyate  rāhuḥ āditya candrau ca trayaḥ ete grahāḥ yadā
translated: The eclipse of the sun is taught in the world.🔽When these three - Rahu, the sun, and the moon - are seen together,

analyzed: dṛśyante samavāyena tat mahāgrahaṇam bhavet
translated: that is a great eclipse.

original: sa kālaḥ sarvalokānāṃ mahāpuṇyatamo bhavet /🔽tatra snānaṃ tathā dānaṃ pūjāhomajapādikam // / //
analyzed: sa kālaḥ sarva lokānām mahā puṇyatamaḥ bhavet  tatra snānam tathā dānam pūjā homa japa ādikam
translated: That time would be the most meritorious for all the worlds.

analyzed: yat kṛtam sādhakaiḥ devi tat ananta phalam bhavet
translated: The bath, charity, worship, oblation, japa etc. done there by the practitioners, O Goddess, would have infinite fruits.

analyzed: tām ca eva ardha tuṭim tyaktvā śukla pakṣa udayaḥ bhavet
translated: Having abandoned that half-tuti, the rise of the bright fortnight would occur.

analyzed: śakti garbhāt adhas sṛṣṭiḥ tasmāt vṛddhiḥ prajāyate
translated: The creation from below the womb of Shakti, therefore, growth takes place.

original: tadārabhya ca karmāṇi śubhānyabhyudayāni ca // / //🔽dhyānamantrādiyuktasya siddhinte nātra saṃśayaḥ /
analyzed: tat ārabhya ca karmāṇi śubhāni abhyudayāni ca  dhyāna mantra ādi yuktasya siddhiḥ te na atra saṃśayaḥ
translated: From that time onwards, the auspicious and prosperous deeds🔽of one endowed with meditation, mantra etc., will undoubtedly lead to accomplishment.

original: prāṇahaṃso yadā prāptas tv adhastāṃ prathamāṃ tuṭim // / //
analyzed: prāṇa haṃsaḥ yadā prāptaḥ tu adhastām prathamām tuṭim
translated: When the Pranahansa (vital breath) reaches the first tuti below,

analyzed: pūrvam ardham tu ahar proktam tuṭi ardham aparam niśā
translated: the first half is said to be the day, and the other half of the tuti is the night.

original: rāśayo graha ṛksāṇi yogāśca karaṇāni ca // / //
analyzed: rāśayaḥ grahaḥ ṛksāṇi yogāḥ ca karaṇāni ca
translated: The signs, planets, rikṣas (lunar mansions), yogas, karaṇas etc.

analyzed: pūrvavat krama yogena tāni udyanti tu aharniśam
translated: rise in the day and night in the order of the previous sequence.

analyzed: pratipad sā tu vijñeyā candraḥ ca eka kalaḥ bhavet
translated: The pratipat (first lunar day) should be known to be when the moon has one kala.

original: dvitīyāyāṃ dvitīyā tu vṛddhimeti krameṇa tu /
analyzed: dvitīyāyām dvitīyā tu vṛddhim eti krameṇa tu
translated: In the second lunar day, the second (kala) increases gradually.

analyzed: tithayaḥ ca evam ārabhya yāvat pañcadaśī tuṭi
translated: The lunar days begin from this up to the fifteenth tuti.

original: paurṇamāsī tu vijñeyā tithirvai sādhakena tu /
analyzed: paurṇamāsī tu vijñeyā tithiḥ vai sādhakena tu
translated: The full moon day should be known as the lunar day by the practitioner.

original: tatra pūjā japo dhyānaṃ saṃpūrṇaṃ saphalaṃ bhavet // / //
analyzed: tatra pūjā japaḥ dhyānam saṃpūrṇam sa phalam bhavet
translated: Worship, japa, and meditation performed on that day become complete and fruitful.

analyzed: saṃpūrṇaḥ ca bhavet tasyām candraḥ vai cāru locane
